title: Product Developer Soft Accessories - H&M Womenswear
description:
**Job Description** *Are you passionate about fashion, driven by results, and excited about turning creative ideas into commercial success?*

*We are looking for a Product Developer with a strategic mindset, a passion for fashion, and a collaborative spirit to join our Accessories team at H&M Womenswear.*

*This position is based at our HQ in Stockholm, Sweden.*

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**  

In this role as a Product Developer, you will take strong ownership of bringing the H&M Women soft accessories assortment to life, including hats, scarves, gloves and more. You will work hands‑on throughout the development process, identifying opportunities, shaping seasonal updates and turning trends and insights into well‑crafted, desirable products that resonate with our customers.


You’ll drive the work forward from idea to final product, ensuring smooth execution in a fast‑paced environment. This includes close collaboration with a product manager, planner and designer, as well as cross‑functional teams across the business. You will also partner directly with production teams and suppliers to secure quality, fit and timely delivery.


With your passion for accessories and product development, you will play an essential role in creating the best products that are beautifully made, on trend and commercially strong.

 **WHO YOU ARE**  

Qualifications:

* 5+ years of experience in a similar role as Product Developer within accessories
* Education in Textiles, Buying or Product Development
* Proven track record in creating accessories products for the womenswear customer with a strong sense of fashion and refined taste
* Excellent insight into current fashion trends and the ability to translate them into desirable and commercially relevant accessories
* Deep passion for product and product development, with a strong interest in soft accessories
* Driven, structured and proactive in taking initiative
* Commercial mindset with a results-oriented approach
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
* Strong ability to identify opportunities, improvements and efficient solutions across the soft accessories development process

 **WHO WE ARE**  

H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.


We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.

 **JOIN US**  

Additional information:


This is full-time, temporary position with placement in Stockholm. If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your application including CV in English as soon as possible. Interviews will be held continuously. (For internal candidates, please initiate a dialogue with you manager before applying.) If you are currently in a permanent employment with H&M you will keep your permanent employment even if you take on a temporary position for a limited time.


Benefits:  

At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP.


Inclusion & Diversity:  

H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.


We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.  



**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**
company_description: At H&M, we welcome you to be yourself and challenge you to grow and make a difference. Help us reimagine the future of an entire industry, making everyone look, feel & do good.

title: Senior Software Developer - Tieto Caretech (m/f/d)
description:
Job Description **At Tieto Caretech you’ll get a chance to provide patients and end users with product offerings that help them in their life, reinventing the world for good. If that sounds interesting, please keep on reading.**

**About us**


Tieto Caretech is modernizing the Nordic health and social care sector with modular, open, and interoperable software. We develop and deliver high quality software solutions and services that enable healthcare and welfare professionals to do their work even better and with higher efficiency - have more time to care.


We are a global team of professionals working on providing products and services to different sectors from intensive care to laboratory and social care. In addition to working closely with our customers, we also have our own products that we build and develop for various fields in society. From enabling healthcare professionals to spend more valuable time with their patients to providing data for professional athletes to achieve even better results, we make all that possible. With us you can build technology for the good of society and make your mark on the health and wellbeing of people in need.

**About the role**


In the Client Integration Team, we provide software development expertise integrating Lifecare, our health and social care management system into the client’s existing ecosystem. Our team consists of professionals in software development and architecture, and it delivers solutions that make our customer’s work life more efficient and effective.  

  

We are now looking for Senior Software Developers for our Client Integration Team to focus on bringing our product to new municipalities and integrating with their current systems and workflows. Your daily work consists of designing and developing software using Microsoft .NET (C#). You'll work in close collaboration with internal and external architects and developers.

**In this role you will**

* Design Software
* Develop Software
* Create Documentation
* Work with internal and external stakeholders

**We are looking for someone with experience in**

* Microsoft .NET (C#)
* Microsoft SQL Server
* Building and consuming REST-based APIs
* Creating Documentation

**It would be beneficial if you also**

* Experience working with API Gateway solutions
* Enterprise Integration Patterns
* Excellent oral and written communication skills in English and Swedish

 **What’s in it for you?**


With us you will be part of the important and meaningful work of developing healthcare for all of us. You have an important mission to make a difference that really matters. In addition, as a company we offer you professional growth, open and friendly culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working.


Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle. We want to encourage you to keep up that curiosity and deepen your knowledge on topics you’re interested in. For example, we host an annual ‘Keep Learning Week’, a week where everyone at Tieto has the possibility to join different training courses in a truly global setting.

 **Could you be our new colleague?**


We look forward to hearing from you! We will fill the position as soon as we find the right person, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact the hiring manager john.waxler@tieto.com

*We perform background checks on all final candidates.*

*Tieto declines calls from recruitment companies.*

  

Additional Information  

At Tieto, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity.


Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)
company_description: Join our team to create purposeful technology that reinvents the world. For good.

title: Developer – Business Applications (Dynamics 365 & Power Platform)
description:
**Work Schedule**


Standard (Mon-Fri)**Environmental Conditions**


Office**Job Description**


As part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you’ll discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to life every single day to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We provide our global teams with the resources needed to achieve individual career goals while helping to take science a step beyond by developing solutions for some of the world’s toughest challenges, like protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe or helping find cures for cancer.


Our proteomic sciences (PSX) solutions are transforming the understanding of human diseases through advanced protein biomarker discovery. With our innovative solutions – including highly specific and validated assays that cover more than 5,000 proteins – our colleagues and technology empower scientists in groundbreaking research that will play a pivotal role in the future of personalized medicine.


Our systems support operations enable life sciences research, diagnostics, and healthcare innovation worldwide. We are now looking for a Developer to strengthen our Business Applications team, with a primary focus on Microsoft Dynamics 365 and the Microsoft Power Platform.


In this role, you will develop and maintain business-critical solutions supporting our ERP landscape and core business processes within a regulated life sciences environment. You will work hands-on with Dynamics 365 and Power Platform technologies, ensuring solutions are scalable, secure, and compliant with internal quality standards and applicable regulatory requirements.


This position reports to the Business Applications Manager within the Proteomics Division IT organization.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Design, develop, and maintain solutions within Microsoft Dynamics 365
* Develop customizations and configurations within the Power Platform
* Develop Power Automate flows for system integrations and process automation
* Create and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards, including data models and calculations, to support operational and quality reporting
* Develop and maintain integrations between D365, Power Platform, and other enterprise systems
* Ensure solutions comply with internal quality standards, GxP requirements, and data integrity principles
* Produce and maintain structured technical documentation, including design specifications and test documentation
* Provide second- and third-line support for business-critical systems

**Qualifications & Experience:**

* Relevant higher education within IT or a related field — or equivalent practical experience
* Several years of experience in Microsoft-based development environments
* Experience working within life sciences, GxP frameworks, or other regulated industries is highly meriting
* Microsoft certifications within Dynamics 365 or Power Platform are meriting

**Technical Competence:**

* Several years experience in programming and integration using; C#, SQL, .NET Framework, Dataverse, Power Platform and webhooks
* Strong knowledge of Power BI data modelling
* Experience with Azure services and integrations
* Solid knowledge of SQL and relational database concepts
* Understanding of DevOps practices
* Knowledge of data integrity, access control, and system compliance principles

**Personal Profile**

* Structured and detail-oriented with a strong quality mindset
* Strong ability to produce clear and accurate documentation
* Analytical, solution-focused, and proactive
* Fluent communication skills in English and Swedish
* Able to combine strong technical skills with the ability to communicate effectively with non-technical stakeholders


Apply today! Please apply as soon as possible, the position will be filled as soon as suitable candidate is found.
company_description: At Thermo Fisher Scientific, our professionals develop critical solutions—and build rewarding careers.

title: Senior Backend Developer to Vertiseit
description:
Are you passionate about building scalable, cloud-native platforms? Join us in shaping the leading in-store experience management platform for global brands and leading retailers.


At Vertiseit Group, we’re on a mission to become the world’s #1 platform company for digital in-store. We're now looking for a talented backend developer to join our team working at the heart of our technology - building and evolving the core platform that powers our business brands: Grassfish, Dise, and Visual Art.

### **The Role**


You’ll join a strong cross-functional development team focused on developing our **shared platform** (internally known as IXM Grid). It’s the backbone of our group’s software solutions (IXM Platforms), enabling modularity, speed, and innovation across brands - through microservices, API-first architecture, and cloud-native capabilities. We work with cutting-edge technologies and enjoy technology discussions and pair programming.


In this role, you will:

* Design, develop, and optimize high-quality software solutions
* Ensure the reliability, scalability, and performance of our software
* Stay updated with industry trends and continuously improve our technology stack
* Contribute to technical discussions, code reviews, and knowledge-sharing within the team

**Technologies you’ll get to work with**

* C#
* .NET 10
* MS SQL Server and Entity Framework Core 10
* Communication protocols with REST API, SignalR and gRPC
* Unit testing using xUnit
* SaaS solution based on a microservices architecture on Azure Container Apps
* Azure services such as Azure Container Apps, Container Registry, Storage Account, SQL Server, Application Insights, Key Vault, App Configuration, Azure Functions etc.
* Infrastructure as Code via Terraform
* CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions

### **Who You Are**


We are looking for a passionate and experienced developer with a strong problem-solving mindset, a drive for innovation and a deep technical understanding. You possess a great deal of curiosity and like to learn and teach others. You are happy to work both individually and together with others. We would like to see that you have worked with the entire chain of a product life cycle.


To succeed in this role, we see that you have:

* Several years hands-on experience as a software developer
* In-depth knowledge of building backend solutions with Microsoft technology stack
* Strong proficiency in modern programming languages and frameworks, such as C# and .NET
* Great experience in delivering well-tested, maintainable and functioning code
* Experience working with Cloud development, particularly Microsoft Azure Container Apps
* Solid knowledge of databases, APIs and system integrations
* A proactive and team-oriented mindset – you take ownership and drive development forward
* Strong communication skills inEnglish


Nice to have:

* Familiarity with DevOps practices such as CI/CD pipelines
* Strong communication skills inSwedish
* A good understanding of SQL, specifically T-SQL

### **Why Join Vertiseit?**


We offer an inclusive work environment where you will be surrounded by skilled and passionate colleagues.

* Well-being first – Enjoy health initiatives and a generous wellness allowance
* Team spirit & fun – We believe in having fun together and organizing activities to create great memories
* Learn & grow – Work alongside talented colleagues in a collaborative and knowledge-sharing environment
* Career opportunities – We invest in internal career paths and development opportunities to help you grow with us

### **Practical Information**


**Location:** Full-time position at our office in Varberg or Stockholm  

**Application deadline:** March 31th (We recruit on an ongoing basis, so apply as soon as possible!)  

**Questions?** Contact Hiring Manager Lisa Spjut at lisa.spjut@vertiseit.com


You can submit your application in Swedish or English. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Fullstack systemutvecklare Python
description:
**Professional Galaxy** är ett IT och teknikkonsultbolag som tillhandahåller högspecialiserad kompetens inom IT, utveckling, elektronik och mekanik konstruktion. Vi arbetar med seniora experter och levererar strategiskt värdeskapande kompetens till några av Sveriges mest komplexa och samhällskritiska projekt. Vårt fokus ligger alltid på hög kvalitet, professionalism och mätbara resultat.


Är du rätt person för uppdraget, eller vill du rekommendera en stark kandidat? Tveka inte att kontakta oss.


Ansök gärna redan idag – urval och intervjuer sker löpande.


Professional Galaxy söker en **Fullstack systemutvecklare Python** på uppdrag av vår klient.


VI söker nu en erfaren fullstack systemutvecklare för ett konsultuppdrag där du får bidra till utvecklingen av samhällsviktiga digitala tjänster inom klimat, vatten och luftmiljö.


Detta är ett konsultuppdrag där du arbetar på uppdrag av företag, inom deras utvecklingsverksamhet kopplad till avdelningen för Samhällsplanering.

**Om uppdraget**  

Uppdraget avser en (1) fullstack systemutvecklare som ska förstärka företags utvecklingsverksamhet. Konsulten ska kunna arbeta med både front- och backend inom ramen för företags digitala tjänster och interna system.


Uppdraget kommer initialt att utföras inom team som ansvarar för system kopplade till företags avdelning för Samhällsplanering. Dessa team utvecklar och förvaltar bland annat tjänster inom vattenwebb, klimat- och luftmiljöområdet.


Företags utvecklingsarbete bedrivs enligt agila metoder i självorganiserande team. Konsulten ska ha erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila utvecklingsmiljöer och förväntas bidra aktivt i teamets gemensamma arbete.

**Arbetsuppgifter**  

Arbetsuppgifterna omfattar bland annat:


utveckling och vidareutveckling av webbtjänster och backendfunktionalitet  

deltagande i kravnedbrytning och tekniska lösningsdiskussioner  

utformning och implementering av användargränssnitt  

samarbete med produktägare/beställare och övriga teammedlemmar  

aktiv kunskapsöverföring inom teamet  

Teknisk miljö  

Linux som målmiljö  

Backend: Python och Java  

Frontend: JavaScript, CSS, QGIS samt övriga relevanta webbtekniker  

Databas: PostgreSQL  

  

**SKA-krav**  

* Kompetensnivå 4 (9-12 år).
* Minst tre (3) års dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av responsiv frontendutveckling med JavaScript och/eller TypeScript samt HTML och CSS. Arbetet ska ha omfattat utveckling av välstrukturerad och underhållbar kod.
* Minst ett (1) års dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av frontendutveckling med React som modernt JavaScript-ramverk/bibliotek.
* Minst två (2) års dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av backendutveckling av webbtjänster och API:er i Python. Erfarenheten ska avse utveckling och förvaltning av serverkod i produktionsmiljö.
* Obehindrat behärska svenska språket flytande i både tal och skrift, samt ha goda kunskaper såväl muntligt som skriftligt i engelska språket.
* Den sammanlagda arbetslivserfarenheten ska motsvara 100% av en heltidstjänst för den period som efterfrågas och inte vara äldre än tio (10) år. Arbetslivserfarenhet som åberopas för att uppfylla flera krav får överlappa tidsmässigt
  

**BÖR-krav**  

* Minst ett (1) års dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av backendutveckling av webbtjänster och API:er i Java.
* Minst två (2) års dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av användning av Git och GitLab för ärende- och versionshantering samt etablering och användning av CI/CD-pipelines inom teambaserade systemutvecklingsprojekt. Offererad konsult ska vidare inneha dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete i Linux-baserad utvecklings- och/eller driftmiljö.
* Minst två (2) års dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av att arbeta med automatiserad testning av frontend- och/eller backendkod, exempelvis genom enhets- och integrationstester.
* Minst ett (1) års dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av att arbeta med geodata och karttjänster i samband med utveckling av webbapplikationer, exempelvis med stöd av QGIS.
**Other information :**  

Omfattning: 100%  

Distans: På plats. Viss möjlighet till distansarbete efter överenskommelse.  

Uppdragsperiod: 2026-04-01 – 2027-03-31  

Option: 3 x 12 månader  

Säkerhetsprövning: Nej  

Intervjuer planeras att genomföras under vecka 10–11

**Sista ansökningsdag:** 2026-02-25


Ansök genom att bifoga ditt CV (vi vill inte ha något personligt brev) och besvara urvalsfrågorna. Frågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.

title: Senior mjukvaruutvecklare – Mission Planning & avancerade system
description:
**Professional Galaxy** är ett IT och teknikkonsultbolag som tillhandahåller högspecialiserad kompetens inom IT, utveckling, elektronik och mekanik konstruktion. Vi arbetar med seniora experter och levererar strategiskt värdeskapande kompetens till några av Sveriges mest komplexa och samhällskritiska projekt. Vårt fokus ligger alltid på hög kvalitet, professionalism och mätbara resultat.


Är du rätt person för uppdraget, eller vill du rekommendera en stark kandidat? Tveka inte att kontakta oss.


Ansök gärna redan idag – urval och intervjuer sker löpande.


Professional Galaxy söker en **Senior mjukvaruutvecklare – Mission Planning & avancerade system** på uppdrag av vår klient.


Vi söker nu en senior mjukvaruutvecklare till ett kvalificerat konsultuppdrag hos vår kund inom försvarsindustrin. Uppdraget är tekniskt avancerat och riktar sig till dig som vill arbeta med robust, prestandakritisk mjukvara i system där kvalitet, precision och tillförlitlighet är avgörande.


Du blir en viktig del av ett erfaret och agilt utvecklingsteam som vidareutvecklar ett världsledande långräckviddigt system, där din insats har direkt påverkan på både teknisk utveckling och projektets framgång.

**Om uppdraget**


Uppdraget omfattar mjukvaruutveckling av avancerade missil- och Mission Planning-system. En central del av arbetet är vidareutveckling av ett mission planning-system som står inför omfattande uppgraderingar avseende prestanda, autonomi och hantering av stora och komplexa datamängder.


Systemet ställer mycket höga krav på noggrannhet, modularitet och teknisk precision. Arbetet är därför både komplext och utvecklande, med stort fokus på hållbar design och teknisk innovation.

**Som konsult deltar du genom hela utvecklingscykeln och arbetar bland annat med:**


Systemarbete och kravhantering  

Design och mjukvaruarkitektur  

Implementation i prestandakritiska miljöer  

Test, verifiering och felsökning  

Leverans och vidareutveckling i nära samarbete med teamet  

Arbetet omfattar flera nivåer i systemet – från hårdvarunära mjukvara till applikationslogik och användargränssnitt – och bedrivs enligt agila arbetssätt.


**Krav**


För att vara aktuell för uppdraget krävs att du har:

* Senior erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling (nivå 4)
* Djupgående kunskaper i C och C++
* Erfarenhet av designarbete och mjukvaruarkitektur
* Erfarenhet av mjukvarutestning och kvalitetssäkring
* Vana att arbeta i agila team
* Förmåga att arbeta strukturerat i tekniskt krävande och säkerhetskritiska miljöer

***Meriterande:***

*Erfarenhet av Ada*  

*Erfarenhet av CUDA*


**Övrig information**


Arbetsmodell: 100 % på plats  

Uppdragsperiod: 2026-04-06 - 2026-12-31  

Möjlighet till förlängning: Ja  

Säkerhet: Uppdraget kräver genomförd och godkänd säkerhetsprövning enligt gällande säkerhetsskyddsbestämmelser. För vissa befattningar kan krav på svenskt medborgarskap förekomma.

**Sista ansökningsdag:** 2026-02-26

title: Software Developer
description:
**Professional Galaxy** är ett IT och teknikkonsultbolag som tillhandahåller högspecialiserad kompetens inom IT, utveckling, elektronik och mekanik konstruktion. Vi arbetar med seniora experter och levererar strategiskt värdeskapande kompetens till några av Sveriges mest komplexa och samhällskritiska projekt. Vårt fokus ligger alltid på hög kvalitet, professionalism och mätbara resultat.


Är du rätt person för uppdraget, eller vill du rekommendera en stark kandidat? Tveka inte att kontakta oss.


Ansök gärna redan idag – urval och intervjuer sker löpande.


Professional Galaxy söker en **Software Developer** på uppdrag av vår klient.

**Uppdragsbeskrivning** – Vidareutveckling av prototyp för Ground Combat Station  

Vi arbetar med drönarapplikationer och har utvecklat en prototyp för en Ground Combat Station. Nästa steg är att definiera hur denna prototyp ska vidareutvecklas till en robust, skalbar och långsiktigt hållbar lösning.


Vi utgår från att det inom företag finns befintliga plattformar, ramverk eller initiativ som kan fungera som byggblock eller integrationsplattformar för vår applikation. Syftet med uppdraget är att identifiera och utvärdera dessa möjligheter samt bedöma hur de kan möta våra tekniska och operativa krav.

**Uppdragets omfattning**  

Konsulten kommer att:


Analysera den befintliga prototypen, inklusive arkitektur och teknisk inriktning  

Identifiera och utvärdera relevanta interna plattformar och initiativ inom företag  

Bedöma hur dessa plattformar kan stödja våra operativa användningsfall och systemkrav  

Föreslå en utvecklingsstrategi och arkitekturell inriktning  

Bidra praktiskt genom prototyparbete och demoimplementationer för att validera koncept  

Önskad profil

**Vi söker en person som har:**


God förståelse för IT-system som används i stridsnära miljöer för planering, genomförande och uppföljning av militära insatser  

Erfarenhet av systemarkitektur och plattformsbaserad utveckling  

Förmåga att analysera och värdera tekniska plattformar i relation till verksamhetskrav  

Ett pragmatiskt och hands-on arbetssätt med erfarenhet av prototyper och proof-of-concept  

Förmåga att kombinera ett helhetsperspektiv med konkret implementation  

Vi tror att kunskap byggs genom att lära genom att göra. Därför söker vi en person som kan förena strategiskt tänkande med praktiskt utvecklingsarbete och demonstratorframtagning.

**Övrig information**

title: Front-End Developer till Axis i Lund!
description:
Vill du arbeta med modern webbutveckling i en tekniskt stark miljö där kvalitet, lärande och samarbete står i centrum? Nu söker vi en Front-End Developer till Axis i Lund.

**Om rollen**
-------------


I rollen som utvecklare arbetar du med att bygga och vidareutveckla moderna webbapplikationer och molnbaserade lösningar. Du är delaktig genom hela utvecklingsprocessen – från idé och design till implementation och förbättring.


Fokus ligger på frontendutveckling och du kommer *främst* arbeta med:

* TypeScript
* React
* JavaScript


Du bidrar i tekniska diskussioner, kodgranskningar och gemensam problemlösning, med målet att skapa hållbara och välgenomtänkta lösningar.

**Vem är du?**
--------------


Vi söker dig som *är civilingenjör* – gärna inom elektroteknik, teknisk fysik, datateknik eller liknande – och som har en stark teknisk grund. Du har ett genuint intresse för programmering och problemlösning, och trivs med logiskt tänkande och tekniska utmaningar.


Vi tror att du:

* Har erfarenhet av webbutveckling
* Har arbetat med React, TypeScript och JavaScript
* Har ett starkt driv att utvecklas tekniskt
* Trivs i en miljö där man samarbetar och lär av varandra
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på engelska (svenska är meriterande)


Erfarenhet av 3D-visualisering, exempelvis arbete med 3D-grafik i webbmiljö, *är meriterande men inget krav.*


Det viktigaste är inte exakt vad du har gjort tidigare – utan din tekniska nyfikenhet, din analytiska förmåga och din ambition att fortsätta utvecklas.


Låter det som rätt nästa steg? Sök redan idag, vi rekryterar löpande!

title: Java-utvecklare till samhällsviktigt inhouse-uppdrag
description:
Ta chansen att bli en del av något större!

  

Nexer har fått i uppdrag att utveckla, effektivisera och förvalta en digital vårdtjänst. Vill du arbeta med att förbättra patientupplevelsen och underlätta för människor att komma i kontakt med vården? Häng med på vår resa där du kommer vara en del av att bidra till en viktig samhällsfunktion.

  

Vi söker nu Java-utvecklare till detta team.


Du blir en del av team bestående av 5 utvecklare, en arkitekt och en scrum master. Vårt team kommer vara fördelat på två orter, Jönköping och Växjö.


I rollen som konsult hos Nexer får du en stabil och trygg anställning. Vi tror på långsiktighet och ett hållbart arbetsliv där vi lägger stor vikt vid både kompetensutveckling och work life balance. Som konsult får du också möjligheten att på sikt testa och utveckla din kompetens i olika uppdrag.

**Vem är du?**


Teamen består av backendutvecklare och fullstackutvecklare med fokus på backend. Yrkeserfarenheten inom java-utveckling måste vara minst 3 år. Förutom Java är övriga kompetenser för dessa team:

* Backend – Java EE, Spring Boot
* Frontend – Angular, Java Server Faces (JFS)
* Svenska flytande i både tal och skrift

  

Har du dessutom erfarenhet av och kunskap inom något eller några av följande områden är det ett plus:

* Cloud services (Azure eller AWS)
* DevOps
* Databas (t ex Maria DB)
* Containerbaserad Openshift-miljö


I våra team är samarbete, kunskapsdelning och innovation viktiga ledord. För att passa in behöver du vara kommunikativ, prestigelös och se det som självklart att hjälpa dina teammedlemmar i olika frågeställningar. Det är viktigt att du vill ge och ta emot konstruktiv feedback. Du har en god problemlösningsförmåga kombinerat med säkerhetstänk och noggrannhet. Vi tror också att din nyfikenhet och passion för att hitta nya lösningar kommer vara en stor tillgång till teamet.

**Vilka är vi på Nexer i Växjö?**


Nexer i Växjö är en plats där hög kompetens, engagemang och sammanhållning är våra ledord. Vårt kontor är hem till en härlig och sammansvetsad grupp av konsulter där varje enskild medarbetares unika talanger och egenskaper värdesätts.


Hos oss får du möjlighet att utvecklas både som person och kompetensmässigt. Teamet i Växjö genomsyras av ett prestigelöst kunskapsutbyte och här får du chans att växa i en inkluderande och stöttande miljö.


För oss är det viktigt att skapa bra förutsättningar så det blir rätt från början. Vi utgår helt enkelt från dig och vad du vill göra. Våra konsulter är hjärtat i vår verksamhet. Vi har som mål att växa med fler konsulter och hoppas att du vill bli en del av Nexer Växjö.


Uppdragen finns hos våra kunder som verkar inom både offentlig och privat sektor. Flertalet av våra kunder inom privat sektor finns inom automotive, försvarsindustrin och automatiserad industri. Som konsult i ett inhouseteam kommer du att utföra arbetet i Nexers lokaler eller hemifrån, ofta i en hybridkombination.

**Ansökan**


Du är varmt välkommen att söka tjänsten genom att skicka in din ansökan här nedan. Enligt GDPR hanterar vi inte ansökningar via e-post men har du frågor om tjänsten eller Nexer är du välkommen att höra av dig till ansvarig rekryterare, Petra Sivefäldt, på petra.sivefaldt@nexergroup.com.


Vi tar emot ansökningar löpande så vänta inte med att söka!

**Läs mer om Nexer här**


www.nexergroup.com

 *#LI-PS1*

title: Java developer
description:
* Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform
* Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards
* Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products
* Be a productive member of the team.


 Requirements
   

  

* This initiative needs to begin immediately. We plan to form a small core team to initiate the transformation and establish an effective way of working, as this will be a long-term engagement.
* In collaboration with representatives from other bank teams (the requesting teams), you will be responsible for receiving and analyzing requirements related to the conversion or new development of existing Java services.
* We are seeking an experienced Java developer with the ambition to take on a team architect role, possessing strong expertise in Spring Boot, OpenShift, Kubernetes, and MQ Sterling.
* The ideal candidate should be highly communicative, proactive, and collaborative, with the ability to effectively share knowledge and support team members.
* Experience with the Andromeda platform (modern Java) is a strong advantage.
* Experience with the TDE platform (legacy Java) is an added benefit, as is prior experience in the banking or insurance domain.


 Benefits
   

  

* A challenging, innovating environment.
* Opportunities for learning where needed.

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
We're Sweden’s largest app and marketplace for booking beauty and health services. As a SaaS-enabled company offering industry leading software we have more than 14,000 connected specialists across the country, we make almost all of Sweden’s salons and clinics bookable in one place — including hairdressers, massage therapists, podiatrists, beauty salons, chiropractors, and many more.
   

  

 At bokadirekt.se, consumers can search, book, and pay for treatments and services with just a few clicks. Every month, over 5 million consumers visit our platform, and nearly 2 million bookings are made through our website and apps. Bokadirekt is growing fast and currently employs over 100 people with offices in Stockholm and Luleå.
   

  

**What We Are Looking For**
 A driven and experienced Fullstack Developer to join our growing tech team at Bokadirekt — Sweden’s leading platform for online bookings and payments within beauty and health.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll be a key player in our Backoffice & CRM team. While our marketplace is what the world sees, you will be building the sophisticated "engine room" that powers our entire organization. You’ll work primarily on our custom-built CRM system and internal support tools—the mission-critical platforms that allow our staff to manage thousands of merchants, handle complex financial data, and provide world-class support.
   

  

 Beyond the CRM, you will also play a vital role in supporting and developing integrations for our ERP system. You’ll ensure that data flows seamlessly between our booking platform, internal business tools, and financial systems, maintaining high standards for data integrity and financial accuracy.
   

  

 Our systems are evolving rapidly. We are moving toward higher levels of automation, improving data scalability, and ensuring seamless synchronization across our internal ecosystem. You’ll work closely with internal stakeholders and product owners to translate complex business requirements into robust, high-performance backend services and functional internal interfaces.
   

  

 We are also investing heavily in AI and automation to simplify administration and leverage data intelligence. You will have a direct impact on how we use technology to make our internal operations smoother, faster, and more data-driven.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 As a Fullstack Developer with a strong backend focus, you’ll take ownership of the full development process — from system architecture and database design to technical implementation. You’ll spend the majority of your time in our .NET backend and SQL Server databases. You will play a vital role in ensuring our core business logic is reliable, scalable, and built for the future.
   

  

* Develop and maintain our core platforms built with .NET
* Work with SQL Server to design and optimize database structures
* Contribute to technical design and architecture decisions
* Collaborate closely with product owners and other developers
* Continuously improve code quality, performance, and delivery processes


**Who You Are**
* 5+ years of experience working as a Fullstack developer
* Solid experience with .NET (C#)
* Strong skills in Postgresql and database development
* Experience working in an agile team environment
* Relevant educational background
* A proactive mindset — you’re driven, accountable, and delivery-focused
* Professional fluency in Swedish and English, both written and spoken


**Bonus points:**
* A degree in Computer Science or related technical field
* Azure or other cloud platforms
* CI/CD pipelines and DevOps principles
* Microservices architecture
* Angular
* Blazor or MVC


**What We Offer**
* The chance to influence our architecture, tech stack, and product direction
* A culture built on collaboration, ownership, and innovation
* Flexible working hours and a hybrid work setup
* Modern office space in central Stockholm
* Competitive salary and benefits package


**About the role:**
 Start date: As soon as possible
   

  

 Location: Central Stockholm (Hybrid)
   

  

 Employment Type: Full-time, Permanent
   

  

**Application:**
 Send in your resume as soon as possible, we are eager to get to know you.
   

  

 We look forward hearing from you!

title: Developer C++
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Strong hands-on experience in C++
* Extensive experience working with automotive software platforms
* Deep understanding of automotive E/E architectures
* Proven background in ECU software development within the automotive industry
* Experience working at both architecture level and implementation level
* Solid knowledge of middleware, ARM-based architectures, and CAN/CAN FD protocols
* Familiarity with AUTOSAR (Classic and/or Adaptive) standards
* Experience in developing robust, safety-conscious embedded software in resource-constrained environments


**Application deadline:** 
 27-02-226
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Senior Fullstack Developer / Backend
description:
**Senior Full-Stack / Backend Developer** 

  




**Stockholm** 

  





**Bygg smarta lösningar. Påverka riktningen. Lyft vår kunds tech-stack till nästa nivå.** 





 Vill du vara med och utveckla produkter som gör verklig skillnad – samtidigt som du får stort ansvar, teknisk frihet och möjligheten att påverka hela utvecklingskedjan?
 




  






 Som
 
**Senior Full‑Stack / Backend Developer** 

  blir du en nyckelperson i ett team som jobbar modernt, agilt och nära användare.
 





 Här får du inte bara skriva kod – du får driva arkitektur, forma arbetssätt och vara med i hela resan från idé till release. Du en del av ett team som
 
*vill framåt* 

 , lär av varandra och tillsammans bygger lösningar som både kunder och användare älskar.
 




  




**Vad du kommer att göra** 
* Ta en ledande roll i utveckling, kravarbete och releasehantering
* Säkerställa att lösningar håller hög kvalitet, både tekniskt och arkitekturiellt
* Arbeta med moderna DevOps‑ och agila metoder
* Integrera, förbättra och bygga API:er och backend‑funktionalitet
* Utveckla tillsammans med kunder och slutanvändare för att lösa riktiga behov
* Påverka tekniska vägval och hur vår kund jobbar framåt
* Här får du kontinuerligt utveckla dina skills – och använda dem i komplexa, verkliga problem.


- 

**Du tar med dig** 
* Mycket goda kunskaper i
 
**Java** 

  (eller annan JVM‑teknik)
* Vana av att arbeta med
 
**API:er** 

  (REST, SOAP m.fl.) och format som
 
**XML, JSON**
* Erfarenhet av
 
**molninfrastruktur** 

  – gärna Google Cloud
* En akademisk examen inom datavetenskap eller motsvarande


- 

**Som person är du** 
* En strukturerad problemlösare med ett analytiskt mindset
* Kommunikativ och trygg i dialog med både verksamhet och IT
* Nyfiken, samarbetsvillig och villig att dela kunskap med teamet
* Passionerad kring att skapa produkter som gör skillnad för kunden


- 

**Plus i kanten (men inte krav)** 
* Erfarenhet av
 
**Spring**
* Kunskap om databaser, nätverk och integrationsprotokoll
* Erfarenhet av moderna frontendramverk som
 
**Angular eller React**
* Vana av
 
**Docker, Kubernetes och microservices**
* Erfarenhet av verktyg som
 
**Jira, Git, Maven och Jenkins**



  




**Varför du kommer att trivas här** 
* Du får stort tekniskt inflytande och är med och formar framtiden
* Du jobbar med ett drivet team som gillar innovation och kvalitet
* Du får arbeta nära användare och se din kod skapa verkligt värde
* Du får möjlighet att växa – både tekniskt och professionellt


- 



 Vill du vara med och bygga nästa generations digitala lösningar?
 




**Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!**

title: Senior Java Developer
description:
**Providing Value & Impact - SwedQ.**
 SwedQ is a consultancy company that has lately proven to have a unique model for those who want to grow, create a legacy, and take on challenges that both add and gain value. Year after year, we have managed to serve clients within a wide range of industries (intentionally excluding gambling and weaponry). During this time, we have also grown steadily—in revenue, in team size, and in the impact of our deliveries.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who wants to be part of the company in a literal sense. That means taking on the technical challenges as well as getting a portion of the company in the future. If you would like, you can also drive your own ideas forward and implement them with us. You’ll be working closely with everyone here, which makes it easy to bring change and act on what you believe in.
   

  

**What's in it for you?**
 Some people value fixed salaries, pensions, and stability. Others want a bigger share of the pie and are ready to share the risks. Let’s talk that through. One thing is certain—we’ll make sure you find your “it,” whether that’s with us in-house or with our clients.
   

  

 We’ll shape the role to fit both your needs and ours. The good thing? You will be surrounded by people who are technically savvy, giving you plenty of opportunities to teach and learn. And if not technically, then perhaps in entrepreneurship. We know - it’s a lot of questions. That’s why we have interviews, right?
   

  

**Who are you:**
* At least 5 years of hands-on experience developing and maintaining production-grade systems using Java/J2EE, with deep expertise in Spring Framework (Spring Boot) and Hibernate/JPA
* Strong experience designing, building, and maintaining RESTful APIs and web services, including proper API design, versioning, and documentation
* Solid hands-on experience with cloud (GCP, AWS, Azure), including deploying, operating, and scaling backend services in cloud environments
* Practical experience working with relational databases such as MySQL, Oracle, or similar, including schema design and performance optimization
* Good understanding of cloud-native architectures and distributed systems, with hands-on experience using Docker and Kubernetes
* Familiarity with event-driven and data-processing technologies such as Kafka and/or Spark is a strong plus
* Experience with unit testing, integration testing, and modern build tools, ensuring high code quality and maintainability
* Ability to work effectively with unclear or evolving requirements, estimate development effort, and contribute to realistic delivery plans
* Strong problem-solving skills and confidence navigating complex systems and technical challenges
* Proven ability to collaborate closely with cross-functional teams and build strong relationships with technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences
* Adaptable mindset and comfort working in fast-changing, dynamic environments
* Fluent in English and Swedish


**SwedQ culture**
 SwedQ began with siblings who brought in people they knew. Those people recommended friends, and from there, the company grew further through open head-hunting. Over time, we’ve built a diverse team with different backgrounds, experiences, and insights.
   

  

 We made sure to amplify this diversity by embracing independence and accountability while driving value-creating work. At the same time, we make sure to have fun—with epic football tournaments, unforgettable trips, and great dinners.
   

  

**Perks & Benefits**
* Competitive salary—you decide your preferred salary model
* Budget to spend on health and gym
* Generous developer budget
* Monthly payments into your additional pension fund
* Private health insurance
* Private healthcare
* Office in the city – a stone’s throw from public transport and lunch restaurants
* Breakfast in the SwedQ office EVERYDAY
* Support for open-source projects and community engagement
* Kick-ass colleagues and mentors at every corner
* Company car (or car allowance)
* Benefits to make life easier—home cleaning, childcare, and more

title: Software Engineer
description:
***Är du backend-utvecklare och vill vara med och skapa framtidens digitala bankupplevelse, tillsammans med andra som brinner för teknik och samhällsnytta?***




  





 Vi söker fler engagerade utvecklare som vill vara med och forma nästa generations digitala tjänster för sparande, investeringar och bank. Hos oss kombineras teknikintresse med samhällsengagemang, i team där gemenskap, samarbete och inkludering är en självklar del av vardagen. Vi tror på ett arbetsliv där det går att vara både ambitiös och mänsklig, där balans och meningsfullhet är lika viktiga som innovation.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Software Engineer hos oss på Avanza blir du en nyckelspelare i en av Sveriges mest spännande teknikresor. Vi har påbörjat en omfattande molntransformering mot Google Cloud Platform (GCP). Vårt mål är tydligt: Till 2030 ska vi huvudsakligen vara helt molnbaserade och under 2026 växlar vi upp tempot rejält med målsättningen att migrera över 100 tjänster.
 



  





 Du kommer att tillhöra ett av våra autonoma team där du jobbar nära din Product Manager och dina designers. Våra team arbetar med Order Management System, strömmad data, höga transaktionsvolymer, datadriven utveckling och Machine Learning. Beroende på vilket team du landar i kommer din vardag handla om allt från att vidareutveckla vår högpresterande on-prem-miljö till att bryta ny mark i molnet. Du får vara med och sätta standarden för hur vi modellerar data och bygger skalbara tjänster i en modern molnmiljö.
 



  





**Din tekniska vardag** 




 Vi rör oss från en arkitektur byggd på Gigaspaces och interna plattformar mot en modern, molnbaserad stack. Där kommer du att arbeta med:
 


* Java som huvudspråk för våra mikrotjänster
* GCP som vår framtida hemvist, där vi bygger för hög tillgänglighet och skalbarhet
* Modern datamodellering i molnet, med Google Spanner för applikationsdata och BigQuery för data warehousing
* Kommunikation via gRPC och händelsestyrda flöden med Kafka



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Vi söker dig som älskar problemlösning och som vill bygga system som gör skillnad för över en miljon kunder. Du är en trygg utvecklare som trivs med att dela med dig av din kunskap och som lockas av utmaningen i att migrera komplexa system till molnet.
 



  





 Som person ser vi att du är en nyfiken och kommunikativ lagspelare som trivs bäst när du får lösa komplexa problem tillsammans med andra. Du tar stort ansvar för den tekniska kvaliteten och drivs av att skriva välstrukturerad, testbar och skalbar kod, samtidigt som du också har ett naturligt helhetstänk, där du vill bidra till både teamets arbetssätt och produktens utveckling.
 



 För att trivas hos oss gillar du en kultur som präglas av prestigelöshet, en miljö där det är självklart att fråga, dela med sig av kunskap och där vi ser varje utmaning eller misslyckande som en möjlighet att lära oss och växa tillsammans.
 



  





**Vi tror att du har** 



* Minst 4 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet
* Gedigen erfarenhet av att bygga och underhålla distribuerade system och API:er i Java
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla och driftsätta tjänster i molnmiljö (Cloud Native)



  





**Det är meriterande om du har** 



* Erfarenhet av Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
* Erfarenhet av molnbaserade databaser såsom Google Spanner och/eller analytiska plattformar som BigQuery, gärna med dbt för datatransformering
* Erfarenhet av vår nuvarande stack (t.ex. Gigaspaces eller liknande in-memory-lösningar) för att hjälpa oss i bryggan mellan on-prem och moln
* Vana av att jobba med händelsestyrd arkitektur (Kafka)



  





**En kultur för gemenskap och hållbarhet** 




 Vi tror att de bästa resultaten uppstår i trygga team där alla får komma till tals. Därför lägger vi stor vikt vid samarbete, öppenhet och arbetsglädje. Vi strävar efter jämställda team där alla känner sig trygga att vara sig själva och bidra med sin unika kompetens. Hos oss får du utrymme att utvecklas i din egen takt och kombinera arbetet med ett hållbart liv.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Skicka din ansökan genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök” nedan.
 



  





 Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, så ansök redan idag!
 



  





*Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag/annonssäljare undanbedes.* 




  





 Avanza är Sveriges ledande plattform för sparande och placeringar. Vi drivs av att förändra branschen genom att utmana de stora bankerna och försäkringsbolagen på den svenska sparmarknaden. Vi vill vara tjänsten som förenklar och förbättrar spararnas ekonomi, oavsett om man älskar aktier eller bara vill ha ett bra sparande. Vår vision är att skapa en bättre framtid för miljoner människor. Därför står våra kunders bästa alltid i fokus, precis som det borde vara. Affärsidén är enkel – mer till dig, mindre till banken. En idé som gett oss Sveriges nöjdaste sparare 16 år i rad.

title: SW Developer to AI Team
description:
*Want to influence the bigger picture? At Saab, you can realise amazing innovations that keep people and societies safe. Together, we can truly make an impact – and your part matters.*
 Your role
   

  

 In this exciting role, you will develop Software that enables AI based Signal Processing. We develop the future of Electronic Warfare (EW), and EW is extremely important in the ongoing conflicts in the world right now. Together with the Design Organization we are building an AI platform. For this we program front-end and back-end scripts to be able to quickly store data search, train and execute models and evaluate AI-based signal processing. The tasks for this position are varied, the environment is dynamic and what needs to be done is changing rapidly.
   

  

 The team works in an energetic environment that with a broad knowledge within SW Development and Data analysis. Everyone needs to learn the Electronic Warfare domain. To achieve this the team has developed excellent communication and collaboration skills. We are a team characterized with good collaborative climate that loves to solve problems together.
   

  

 Your profile
   

  

 To be the right fit for this position we believe that you are comfortable with a role as full stack developer creating our AI Factory. We believe you are a person with the mindset of a problem solver that will perform what it takes to reach working solutions. You should be eager to learn and have the ability to quickly absorb new information and knowledge.
   

  

 Key competencies for this position are:
   

  

* Python, JavaScript
* Kubernetes
* Docker
* Kubeflow/Airflow
* Web front-end frameworks
* S3, PostgreSQL
* Jenkins


 It is highly advantageous if you have experience from Electronic Warfare.
   

  

 This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.
   

  

 The position is based in Järfälla.
   

  

 What you will be part of
   

  

 Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
   

  

 Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 25,500 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

 Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement.

title: .NET Software Engineer
description:
**A Little Bit About Our Team**
 X5 is a Stockholm based leader in the music industry that combines fast moving startup vibes, with the backbone strength and opportunities that come from being part of Warner Music Group. X5 creates and delivers music products to all the major music platforms, using our purpose-built in-house application suite. We are a small and dedicated team, combining both tech prowess and music expertise to connect music listeners with the music they love. We work in a hybrid model and offer a modern office with beautiful views of central Stockholm.
   

  

**Your Role**
 As a Software Engineer at X5, you will be an important part of building our music business application suite. Our applications help us create the best music products possible based on a vast music catalogue while visualizing trends and financial data to all our stakeholders, including labels and artists. You will be work on a small team of dedicated engineers, collaborating closely with the users and stakeholders of our applications. You will dive deep into the business processes and applications supporting them, and take end-to-end ownership to ensure they run smoothly and are continuously improved upon.
   

  

**Here You’ll Get To**
* Take end-to-end ownership and develop some of our most important business applications: keep them stable, resilient, and easy to maintain while driving continuous improvements over time.
* Contribute to technical direction by proposing improvements and helping evolve standards and practices—in collaboration with the team.
* Write and refactor code with maintainability and performance in mind, improve automated testing, and have sound judgment when making design tradeoff decisions. You will also contribute high-quality code reviews.
* Build, ship, and operate your code: improve CI/CD pipelines, strengthen our infrastructure‑as‑code, and ensure smooth deployments.
* Monitor and understand production system behavior, improve observability, and drive performance and scalability improvements by testing, identifying bottlenecks, and implementing optimizations.
* Lead root cause analyses for incidents and implement corrective actions that improve long‑term reliability.
* Learn and grow as a professional through close collaboration with your team members as well as our end users and stakeholders, and by being part of a culture of continuous improvement and learning.


**About You**
* You are a curious and dedicated software engineer with at least 3 years of experience with building complex systems in C#/.NET.
* You have a degree (or equivalent education) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or other related field.
* You thrive in taking end-to-end ownership for your area and work closely together with the tech team as well as other stakeholders to create world-class products.
* You are passionate about writing clean, maintainable code and understand how it fits into the bigger picture.
* You are comfortable working with the whole stack including relational databases, cloud platforms, CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure as code.
* You are an effective communicator who can bridge technical and non-technical discussions and simplify complex topics.
* You work proactively and involve the right stakeholders before making changes that impact others.


**We’d Love It If You Also Had**
* Experience or interest in Microsoft Business Intelligence Suite including Azure Data Factory, Synapse, and Power BI
* Hands on Azure experience
* Experience using the latest AI tools in your workflow

title: Mid-level Fullstack developer
description:

title: Platform Engineer - Developer Experience
description:
**TL;DR** 
 We are seeking a Platform Engineer to enhance and scale Lovable's developer experience. In this role, you will be responsible for critical components of our stack, ensuring our engineering workflows are faster, smoother, and more
 **Lovable** 
 .
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* You have strong programming skills and a track record of improving developer velocity and system reliability.
* 7+ years of experience working in a platform team supporting developer experience (o11y, CI/CD, application frameworks, productivity tooling, etc).
* You’ve written code and tools to support growing engineering orgs in scale-ups.
* You have experience with Docker, Kubernetes and modern infrastructure practices.
* You’re a problem-solver who thrives on challenges and ships high-leverage systems fast.
* You’re comfortable navigating ambiguity and solving problems as they arise.
* You care about security, stability, and speed and know when to make trade-offs between them.
* You’re based in Stockholm or ready to relocate - this is an on-site, 5-days-a-week role.


**What You’ll Do**
**In one sentence:** 
 Own and scale the developer experience at Lovable, making our engineering teams the most productive in the world.
   

  

* Bring order and structure to our code base.
* Integrate or build application frameworks to support a growing engineering organization and code footprint
* Own and develop our observability stack, from code instrumentation through ingestion to presentation.
* Integrating tools for AI driven development.
* Identify and drive reliability improvement efforts across all engineering teams.


**Our tech stack**
 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love. Lovable platform engineers are capable of working across the whole stack. Examples of tech in our stack include:
   

  

* Frontend: React and Typescript.
* Backend: Golang and Rust.
* Cloud: Cloudflare, GCP, AWS, Modal.
* Data: Clickhouse, Firestore, Spanner, BigQuery.
* DevOps Tooling: CI/CD pipelines, OTEL, Grafana, kubernetes, terraform.
* Local Tooling: Nix, DevEnv.


 And always on the lookout for what's next!
   

  

**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English - it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal

title: Senior Backend Developer (Ruby/Rails) On-Site/Hybrid
description:
**Let's shape the future of renting together.**
**Who We Are**
 Qasa is a fast-growing scale-up transforming the rental housing market across the Nordics. Since launching in 2014, we’ve been focused on making renting easier, safer, and more accessible for both landlords and tenants.
   

  

 What started as a small startup is now the leading rental platform in Sweden — and we’re just getting started. We’re expanding across the Nordics with a highly skilled, driven team passionate about building a product that makes a real difference in people’s lives.
   

  

 If you're excited about having a meaningful impact on a product that helps people find and rent homes, one of life’s most essential needs, then you might be the person we’re looking for.
   

  

 We’re now looking for another
 **senior Ruby backend developer** 
 to join our team and help shape the platform behind the rental experience for thousands of people across the Nordics.
   

  

**What Will You Do**
* Design and build our scalable backend system in Ruby on Rails
* Work closely with product, design, and other engineers to deliver features end-to-end
* Improve and maintain our API and internal services
* Contribute to architectural decisions and technical direction
* Take ownership of your work, from idea to production
* Mentor and inspire junior colleagues


**What You Have**
* 7+ years of experience working with Ruby and Ruby on Rails
* A solid grasp of system design and architectural principles
* The ability to structure clean, modular, and scalable codebases
* A strong preference for writing maintainable, understandable code over clever abstractions
* Confidence in building gems for internal use, when off-the-shelf gems fall short


**Who You Are**
 You’re humble, collaborative, and thoughtful — someone who sees software development as a team sport. You don’t guard “your” code and are always ready to pair up, share ideas, and iterate together. You take pride in delivering quality work, but never at the expense of others.
   

  

 You thrive in a fast-moving environment, learn quickly, and enjoy challenging yourself. You’re driven to get things done — not because of pressure or competition, but because you care about your work's impact.
   

  

 You value clear communication, kind feedback, and supporting your teammates. The right mindset and a strong cultural fit are more important than checking every box on a tech list. If that sounds like you, you’ll feel right at home here.
   

  

 You’re self-driven and comfortable taking initiative, whether that means improving an existing system, suggesting a better approach, or picking up something that needs doing. You care about progress and quality, and you enjoy helping move both the product and the team forward.
   

  

**Why Qasa?**
* A supportive and ambitious team that cares about what we’re building
* A real product solving real problems — used by people every day
* Flexible work: join us in our bright, modern office at Medborgarplatsen in central Stockholm
* Competitive salary and benefits
* A chance to make a meaningful impact in a growing company


 Sound like a good fit? We’d love to hear from you. Apply now or reach out if you have questions — we’re happy to chat.
   

  

 Tech stack
   

  

* Ruby 3.4.8, 4.0.1
* Rails 8.1.2
* Minitest ~> 5.0, Phlex ~> 2.0
* Postgres, Redis, ElasticSearch, GoodJob
* GitHub, AWS, Honeybadger


 Hiring process
   

  

* Initial screening call – a brief conversation about your background, experience, and what you’re looking for (~30 minutes)
* Technical interview with the Hiring Manager – a deeper dive into your technical experience, including hands-on pairing (~1.5 hours, on-site)
* Culture interview with the CTO and CPO – a discussion of values, collaboration, and how we work together (~1 hour, on-site)
* Offer and reference checks


 Perks and benefits
   

  

* Central location – Right in the middle of Södermalm in Stockholm. This is a place for you to find working peace without ever being more than one elevator ride away from the pulse of the city.
* Generous wellness grant – We provide you with a generous wellness grant (Friskvårdsbidrag). If you feel good, the company feels good. Simple as that.
* All equipment you need – We supply you with quality equipment when you work with us. Let us know what you need to thrive, and we will get it for you.
* Open door afterwork – On Fridays, we get together for a beer or two. Feel free to invite friends!
* Collaborative Community – We work and play together. We help each other to reach our goals. Together we are stronger.

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

 Your role
   

  

 As an Embedded Software Engineer, you will focus on developing embedded software, mainly but not exclusively within the Automotive Industry in Stockholm.
   

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*
* Developing software using C and C++ programming languages.
* Using MATLAB and Simulink for modeling and potentially generating C code.
* Writing unit tests or other test cases (Python).
* Working with real-time operating systems (RTOS) and embedded Linux or other embedded operating systems.


**Your Profile**
* At least 5 years of experience with embedded programming in C/C++.
* Experience with MATLAB and Simulink.
* Experience with hardware-related programming and debugging, including JTAG and other debugging tools.
* Knowledge of real-time operating systems (RTOS) and experience with embedded Linux or other embedded operating systems.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* Innovative Projects: Dive into exciting projects at the forefront of automotive development, shaping the future of mobility.
* Top-Notch Tools: Access the latest tools and technologies, empowering you to excel in your craft.
* Collaborative Environment: Work alongside a talented team of professionals, collaborating seamlessly to conquer challenges and achieve excellence.
* Continuous Growth: Fuel your passion for learning with ongoing training and development opportunities, staying ahead of the curve in the ever-evolving automotive landscape.


**Application and Contact**
 Selection and interviews are running continuously. Apply now since we assign roles during the whole application time span. Kindly note that due to GDPR, we will not accept applications via mail. Please use our career site.
   

  

 We kindly but firmly refrain from direct contact with staffing, brokerage, and recruitment companies as well as other external actors and sellers of additional job advertisements.
   

  

*Please note that identity and background checks may be conducted as part of the recruitment process.*
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: D365 F&O Technical Lead
description:
**About Us:** 




 Tech Mahindra offers technology consulting and digital solutions to global enterprises across industries, enabling transformative scale at unparalleled speed. With 150,000+ professionals across 90+ countries helping 1100+ clients, TechM provides a full spectrum of services including consulting, information technology, enterprise applications, business process services, engineering services, network services, customer experience & design services, AI & analytics, and cloud & infrastructure services. It is the first Indian company in the world to have been awarded the Sustainable Markets Initiative’s Terra Carta Seal, in recognition of actively leading the charge to create a climate and nature-positive future.
 



  





**Title:** 
 D365 F&O Technical Lead
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm Sweden
 



**Years of Experience:** 
 Min. 12+ Years
 



**Onsite/Offsite: Hybrid Remote-** 
 3 days WFO. 2 days Remote
 



  





**Job Description:** 




 As the D365 F&O Technical Lead, you will be the primary authority on the technical health and architectural integrity of our ERP ecosystem. You will bridge the gap between functional requirements and technical execution, leading a global development team to deliver scalable, high-performance solutions. You aren't just overseeing code; you are defining the technical roadmap for a business-critical platform.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Architectural Leadership: Design end-to-end technical architectures for D365 F&O, ensuring alignment with best practices, scalability, and "Update Safe" development standards.
* Team Orchestration: Lead and mentor onshore and offshore development teams. You will be responsible for workload distribution, sprint planning, and technical troubleshooting & development.
* Quality Governance: Conduct rigorous code reviews and enforce strict development standards. Ensure that all extensions and customizations minimize technical debt and maintain upgrade compatibility.
* Integration Strategy: Design and oversee complex integrations between D365 and external systems (PLM, CRM, Banking, etc.) using Azure Integration Services, OData, and Custom Services.
* Environment & ALM Management: Own the Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) process, including build automation, Azure DevOps (CI/CD) pipelines, and environment promotion strategies.
* Strategic Advisory: Act as the technical point of escalation for stakeholders, providing clarity on complex design decisions, performance tuning, and the impact of Microsoft’s "One Version" updates.



  





**Key Skills & Qualifications** 



* Core Technical: Expert-level X++ development, C#, and deep understanding of the D365 F&O Metadata model and AOS.
* Integration: Proven experience with Azure Logic Apps, Azure Functions, Service Bus, and Power Platform (Dataverse/Dual-write).
* Data & Reporting: Proficiency in Electronic Reporting (ER), BYOD, Azure Data Lake, and Power BI integration.
* DevOps: Mastery of Azure DevOps for version control, build definitions, and automated deployments.
* Soft Skills: Strong consultative mindset with the ability to translate "technical speak" into business value for C-suite stakeholders.



  





**Preferred Experience** 



* Experience: 5+ years in Dynamics AX/D365 F&O development, with at least 2 years in a Lead capacity.
* Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Certification: Microsoft Certified: Dynamics 365: Finance and Operations Apps Solution Architect Expert (MB-700) or Developer (MB-300/500)



  





**How To Apply:** 




 It's easy to apply online; you just need a copy of your up-to-date CV and to follow the step-by step process. Don't worry if you need to make changes - you'll have the opportunity to review and edit your work on the final page, or you can also share resume directly to provided email address. We look forward to receiving your application!
 



  





 Tech Mahindra is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We promote and support a diverse workforce at all levels of the company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin or disability. All applicants will be evaluated solely on the basis of their ability, competence, and performance of the essential functions of their positions.

title: Senior Ruby Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Several years of experience as a system developer in a commercial setting.
* Solid hands-on experience with Ruby.
* Experience with Next.js and frontend development.
* Knowledge of software design principles, automated testing, and CI/CD.
* Familiarity with PostgreSQL, Docker and cloud infrastructure (we’re on AWS).
* You understand the importance of time-to-market, performance, code quality and team collaboration.
* You prefer working in iterative development cycles and incremental deployments.
* You’re used to working in agile, cross-functional teams.


**Meritorious**
* Experience with Node.js.
* Knowledge of GraphQL, experience building or using APIs in that format.
* Interest in AI-powered developer tools (e.g. ChatGPT, GitHub Copilot, Claude Code).


**Application deadline:** 
 24-02-2026
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Lead Software Engineer
description:
We’re looking for a Lead Software Developer to join our team, reporting to Director - Software Engineering. In this role, you’ll help shape how we build and evolve real‑time, mission‑critical low latency systems
   

  

 You’ll fit right in if you’re meticulous, highly skilled in
 **object‑oriented programming** 
 , and experienced in
 **low‑latency architectures** 
 and
 **communication protocols** 
 . You should enjoy working across multiple components of a complex system, collaborating with a cross‑functional team, and tackling technical challenges that push the boundaries of performance and reliability.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
