title: QA Engineer
description:
At Umain, we're not just creating software; we're crafting the future, one innovative project at a time. With our motto "Shape, Ship, Scale," we empower our team to not only envision the future but also play a pivotal role in building it. We're a dynamic team where you can shape the future, ship groundbreaking solutions, and scale your abilities in many different ways.
   

  

 We're on the lookout for QA Engineers who see testing as more than checking features. You understand that the purpose of testing is to make risks visible and reduce uncertainty, and you care about improving not only the product but also how the team ensures quality.
   

  

 You enjoy methodical, structured testing, but you’re equally curious about automation and how to make testing smarter, faster, and better integrated into the delivery flow.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A chance to work on unique projects that explore and push the boundaries of what's possible.
* A fun and fair work environment where your you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
* A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
* Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.


 As a QA Engineer at Umain, your role will involve:
   

  

* Analysing user stories and requirements to identify risks and define test cases
* Design, execute, and maintain functional, regression, and exploratory tests
* Build and extend automated tests for UI, API, or backend
* Collaborate with developers to integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines
* Report and communicate quality insights, focusing on what the results mean
* Suggest and implement improvements in testing practices, tools, and processes


 What you bring
   

  

*Structured and analytical testing skills*
* Strong understanding of structured and risk-based test design, drawing on principles from frameworks such as ISTQB or TMAP
* Experience across different test levels including component, integration, system, and UAT
* Ability to design, prioritise, and maintain test cases based on business impact and risk


*Automation and technical mindset*
* Hands on experience with modern automation tools such as Cypress, Playwright, Appium or Postman
* Comfortable writing basic scripts in JavaScript, TypeScript, or Python
* Understanding of APIs, JSON, and CI/CD pipelines such as GitLab, Azure DevOps, or Jenkins
* Treats automation as part of the product codebase, versioned, reviewed, and maintained


*Collaboration and communication*
* Works closely with developers, designers, and product owners to clarify and test assumptions early
* Communicates findings clearly and constructively, focusing on understanding and action
* Helps stakeholders make informed release decisions by putting risks into context


*Ownership and continuous improvement*
* Takes initiative to improve how the team works instead of waiting for others to define it
* Brings ideas for smarter ways of testing or automating repetitive work
* Contributes to making quality a shared team responsibility


*Experience we’d love to see*
* 3 to 6 years of experience in QA, test engineering, or a similar quality focused role
* Experience working in agile, iterative delivery environments such as Scrum or Kanban
* Exposure to end to end digital product development across web, mobile, or backend systems
* Experience from consultancy or multi client projects is a plus
* Fluent in English; other languages are an advantage


 Why Umain?
   

  

* Career Framework:


 We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.
   

  

* Work-Life Balance:


 At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn’t pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognizing the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.
   

  

* Innovations and Learning:


 Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.
   

  

* Skills Over Degrees:


 We’re more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you’ll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.
   

  

**Are You Ready to Shape, Ship, and Scale with Us?**
 If you're a QA Engineer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.
   

  

***Background check***
*Umain conducts a background check for final candidates in accordance with our internal People Procedure (UIS‑007). The check is carried out only with your consent and is ordered by our CISO through our approved screening partner. The scope of the check depends on the role level. This step is performed late in the recruitment process and is used solely to support a secure and fact‑based hiring decision.*
 Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Solution Architect to Finance, Risk and Compliance – Finance Tribe | SEB, Stockholm
description:
SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From COBOL to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.
   

  

 Finance, Risk, and Compliance are undergoing a major transformation—driven by business and regulatory changes as well as significant shifts in architectural design. We’re therefore looking for a Solution Architect with financial and risk know-how to design and implement large-scale data solutions within a highly regulated environment. You will be a vital part of our community driving the Finance, Risk and Compliance agenda in the bank. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, this opportunity is for you!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Solution Architect in our team, you will take end-to-end responsibility for the architecture within a specific area of the tribe. Your work will involve a high degree of complexity, both from a technology and data perspective as well as from a people and process perspective. You’ll work closely with solution and data architects to:
   

  

* Design target architecture and roadmaps to transform legacy solutions to modern cloud-based solutions.
* Ensure compliance with BCBS 239, DORA, and related regulatory traceability requirements.
* Enhance data analytics capabilities, moving beyond traditional reporting.
* Produce architectural designs for initiatives, define solution intent, assess trade-offs, and create comprehensive solution architecture documentation, in line with the business objectives.
* Oversee the implementation of solution architecture, work closely together with tech leads in system design and non-functional requirements.
* Ensure proposed solutions are aligned to the domain architecture.


**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Experience working with architecture including business architecture.
* Solid knowledge of financial and risk management processes within financial institutions to design solutions that meet regulatory and business requirements.
* Proficiency in using ArchiMate for modeling and documentation.
* Competence in cloud environments, preferably with Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* Good understanding of Data Warehouse methodologies and architecture, including data modelling, ETL processes, and data integration techniques.
* Experience in building Business Intelligence and data analytics capabilities.
* Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
* Proven leadership skills to guide teams, build strong relationships, and foster collaboration.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills to convey complex ideas effectively to both business and IT professionals.
* Fluency in English.


**What We Offer**
* A key role in one of SEB’s most challenging IT/Tech area
* Innovative working environment with highly motivated colleagues
* Agile and modern ways of working
* Hybrid work model, meaning remote work is possible up to 2 days/week
* Attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 9 of February 2026. If you have questions about the position, please contact Rita Paškevičiūtė, Technology Head of Architecture and Domain Architect FRC to Corporate Functions, by email rita.paskeviciute@seb.se, but we will not process applications via email.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Enterprise Architect - Logistic and Supply Chain
description:
**Job Description**

 We at H&M Group, have a vision to liberate fashion for the many. Our Enterprise Architecture team helps align and enable business and tech, provide holistic architecture direction and governance, balancing the long-term and the short-term. Using robust frameworks and best practices they support an effective and efficient tech delivery.
   

  





 To strengthen our team, we are now hiring more Enterprise Architects to further level up our support to business and tech in several areas.
   

  





**WHAT YOU’LL DO**




 Our architecture landscape is structured into key segments, with
 **Logistic, Fulfillment & Supply Chain** 
**Solutions** 
 playing a pivotal role evolving the ecosystem with industry best practices in alignment with H&M Business goals.
   

  





 As an Enterprise Architect – Logistic, Fulfillment & Supply Chain, you will shape the future of our global supply chain ecosystem, ensuring seamless alignment between business strategy and technology execution. You will work cross-functionally to define, optimize, and evolve our Logistic & supply chain technology landscape across all touchpoints.
   

  





**You will:**



* Architect and lead the design of Logistic, Fulfillment & Supply Chain technology solutions, ensuring they align with business strategies and operational transformation initiatives to enhance transportation, trade, warehousing, order fulfillment, and returns processing.
* Identify cross-dependencies and guide the organization through business and technology capability changes, optimizing processes, data flows, and system integrations to enable seamless logistics operations.
* Advise and influence stakeholders, providing strategic guidance on investment decisions, assessing options, risks, costs vs. benefits, and business impact to drive informed prioritization.
* Shape the future of supply chain technology, evaluating new operating models, emerging technologies (AI, IoT, automation, digital twins, RPA), and industry trends to optimize business and logistics workflows.
* Continuously improve the tech landscape, reducing technical debt, modernizing the application portfolio, and enhancing end-to-end business value in supply chain and fulfillment ecosystems.
* Lead enterprise architecture practices, supporting architects, engineers, and delivery teams in defining current-state architectures, integration roadmaps, and solution designs to ensure scalability and resilience.
* Establish and maintain architecture governance, developing frameworks, templates, principles, and standards that facilitate best practices and foster an architecture-driven mindset across the organization.
* Ensure alignment of the Supply Chain & Fulfillment architecture with the broader enterprise landscape, setting intentional architecture roadmaps based on capability maps, value streams, processes, and business objectives.
* Drive business outcomes by facilitating and orchestrating segment architecture decisions, ensuring technology investments deliver measurable impact in logistics, fulfillment, and global trade operations.



**YOU’LL WORK WITH**




 As an Enterprise Architect, you will collaborate closely with business stakeholders, architects across different segments, ensuring seamless integration between Logistic, Fulfillment & Supply Chain with the broader enterprise architecture. You will work alongside Solution Architects, Enterprise Architects, and System Architects to define, optimize, and evolve our Logistic & supply chain technology landscape while ensuring alignment with enterprise-wide strategies.
   

  





**WHO YOU ARE**




 We are looking for people with…
   

  




* A bachelor’s or master’s degree in engineering, computer science, technology, or a related field—or equivalent work experience. Certifications in Enterprise Architecture frameworks (e.g., TOGAF) are a plus.
* 10+ years of experience in a Solution or Enterprise Architecture capacity.
* Proven experience in designing and optimizing supply chain and fulfillment solutions in global, consumer-goods organizations.
* Strong expertise in Transportation Management Systems (TMS), Warehouse Management Systems (WMS), Order Management Systems (OMS), and Trade Compliance Solutions.
* Hands-on experience with carrier integrations, last-mile delivery, reverse logistics, AI-powered planning, and IoT-driven warehouse automation.
* Experience in cloud-based supply chain platforms, API-driven ecosystems, and event-driven architectures to enable scalable and resilient logistics operations.
* Expertise in real-time visibility, predictive analytics, robotics, RPA, and digital twins to optimize fulfillment and logistics workflows.
* Deep understanding of regulatory, environmental, and efficiency standards in global logistics and trade.



**Additional Information**




 This is a full-time position with a placement in Stockholm!
   

  

  

  

**WHO WE ARE**
  

 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  





 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. Read more about us here
   

  





**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  





**JOIN US**
  

 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  





 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  





 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Senior IT Architect - Stockholm | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 For our Stockholm office, we are looking for Senior IT Architects to help our clients on national and international projects! (Senior) IT Architects are part of our consulting teams who focus for instance on tech-oriented analyses, review & specification of IT systems or architectures, technical solution design, process improvement and target architecture definitions. Together with colleagues from BCG Platinion and/or the Boston Consulting Group, you will develop superior IT strategies, concepts, and solutions actively and on site, applying your technical know-how combined with your analytical and conceptual skillset. Based on your IT project experience, you are able to provide content guidance to and coordinate smaller teams.
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**You can help us make a difference if you**
* completed a university degree in computer science, informatics, engineering, or a related discipline with higher-than-average grades
* bring a minimum of four years relevant experience in IT consulting, management of IT projects, or professional software development
* have led project teams of more than three people
* know that modern tools, such as machine learning, cyber resilience, DevOps, agile methods, AI, and robotics aren't just buzzwords - but essential to sustainable IT architectures
* are familiar with popular software development methods and tools
* feel particularly comfortable in interdisciplinary teams and global contexts - while traveling to our clients in- and outside of your home country
* are on a fluent level of understanding and communicating complex topics in English


 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape the world of tomorrow**
* You will form the digital transformation of globally leading companies, ensuring their success by evaluating our clients' digital capabilities and performing feasibility studies
* You will manage small, agile development teams in strategic IT implementation programs, establish modern practices like DevOps and CI/CD, and be responsible for the technical implementation of crucial digital requirements, such as cyber resilience
* You will analyze, develop, and optimize cutting-edge, customized IT architectures while leading small teams and applying your comprehensive understanding of legacy IT, enterprise solutions, and current market developments and trends such as cloud computing and microservices


 Additional info
   

  

**How To Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of talented colleagues, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we cultivate a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

*BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable.*
*#BCGPlatinion*
 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Linux Systemadministratör
description:
*Är du en erfaren Systemadministratör med djup kunskap inom Linux? Vill du ta nästa steg i din karriär och arbeta med avancerade IT-lösningar inom drift och infrastruktur?*
 Vi söker en Linux Systemadministratör med några års erfarenhet som har passion för att skapa stabila och effektiva miljöer och som vill spela en nyckelroll inom IT-drift. Här får du arbeta med den senaste tekniken och bidra till att säkerställa högpresterande system och sömlös infrastruktur.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Linux Systemadministratör kommer du att spela en viktig roll i ett driftteam och samarbeta nära med tvärfunktionella team för att säkerställa stabilitet och hög tillgänglighet i system. Du kommer att ha ansvar för att underhålla och optimera Linux-plattformar samt hantera olika aspekter av systemadministration och säkerhet. Din expertis kommer att vara avgörande för att upprätthålla en effektiv och säker IT-miljö, där du arbetar proaktivt för att identifiera och lösa eventuella tekniska utmaningar. Det är en roll där du får möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och bidra till utvecklingen av en stabil och framtidssäkrad infrastruktur.
   

  

**Vi tror att du är en driven systemadministratör som har:**
* Flera års erfarenhet av Linux (exempelvis Red Hat, CentOS, Ubuntu) med en förståelse för systemets ekosystem
* Drift och underhåll av Linux-servrar, inklusive säkerhetskonfigurationer och nätverksadministration
* Kunskap inom automatisering och scripting, gärna erfarenhet med verktyg som Ansible, Puppet eller liknande
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i komplexa IT-miljöer med höga krav på tillgänglighet och säkerhet
* Erfarenhet av containerverktyg som Docker och Kubernetes för att hantera och skala applikationer
* Erfarenhet av webbaserade och serverinriktade tjänster, till exempel Apache, Nginx och databassystem (SQL och noSQL)


**Meriterande erfarenhet**
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD-pipelines och automatisering av deploy-processer
* Kunskap om säkerhetslösningar inom IT-infrastruktur och erfarenhet av avancerade säkerhetskonfigurationer
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med HPC (High-Performance Computing) och GPU/vGPU-hantering
* Erfarenhet av Linux VDI-lösningar och hantering av virtualiserade Linux-miljöer


**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Hos oss får du en stabil anställning med:
   

  

* Konkurrenskraftiga villkor och fast månadslön
* Möjligheter att utvecklas och specialisera dig inom ditt expertområde
* En öppen och trivsam arbetskultur med regelbundna aktiviteter för teamkänsla och gemenskap


**Om oss**
 Vi är en ledande aktör inom drift och IT-infrastruktur och arbetar med marknadsledande företag inom en rad olika branscher. Här får du möjlighet att utvecklas inom avancerade projekt och arbeta med den senaste tekniken. Vi är måna om att våra medarbetare trivs och erbjuder en trygg och utvecklande miljö där du får stöd i din karriärutveckling.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Låter detta som ditt nästa steg? Urval sker löpande, så skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: AI Engineer
description:
**TL;DR** 
 - We’re looking for Founding AI Engineers who will shape how we fine-tune, serve, and evaluate LLMs and frontier models in production - and help define what it means to build a truly lovable AI product.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* Led or contributed to cutting-edge LLM research at top AI labs / globally leading tech startups
* Trained and fine-tuned LLMs on large-scale code, language, or multimodal datasets
* Deep understanding of transformer architectures, attention mechanisms, and model optimization
* Shipped ML systems in production, with real users and real uptime
* Built fast, production-level systems while maintaining strong practices around reproducibility, monitoring, and model performance
* You hold somewhat strong opinions about model safety, latency and helpfulness, but aren’t afraid to experiment


**What You’ll Do**
**In one sentence** 
 : Train, tune, and scale frontier LLMs that power lovable products.
   

  

* Own training pipelines for LLMs, from data curation to evaluation and deployment
* Fine-tune models on high-quality, domain-specific data (code, natural language, product usage signals)
* Work closely with product engineers to integrate models into real user-facing features
* Build retrieval pipelines, evaluation frameworks, and experimentation tools
* Push the limits of what’s possible with current/upcoming open models, and help define what we should train next


**Our tech stack**
 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:
   

  

* Frontend: React for lightning-fast interfaces
* Backend: Golang and Rust for serious performance
* Cloud: Cloudflare, Fly.io, Google Cloud Run, AWS, Terraform
* DevOps & Tooling: CI/CD pipelines, observability, infra-as-code


 And always on the lookout for what's next!
   

  

**How We Hire**
* Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call.
* Join us for a round of technical interviews
* Team intro calls with the team


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English - it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal

title: Information Technology Specialist
description:
*Vi söker en IT-generalist med fokus på SQL som vill vara med och utveckla våra kunders IT-miljöer.* 




*Hos QD får du arbeta brett inom IT-drift och infrastruktur samtidigt som du får använda din SQL-kompetens i allt från felsökning till design och förbättringar.* 




*Du gillar att ha överblick men är inte rädd för att gå ner på detaljnivå när det behövs. Du ser mönster i databasen, hittar orsakerna bakom problemen och gillar att bygga lösningar som fungerar över tid.* 




  





**Om rollen** 




 Som en del av vårt kundteam får du en central roll i att utveckla och drifta kunders IT-miljöer. Du arbetar både operativt och strategiskt. Ibland handlar det om att lösa konkreta utmaningar i databasmiljöer, ibland om att planera förbättringar och framtida förändringar.
 



 Det här är en bred IT-roll där det bland annat ingår en del fokus på SQL som en del av din vardag. Vi söker dig som har kompetens av SQL i drift- och applikationsmiljöer, med fokus på installation, administration, felsökning och stabila lösningar.
 



 Du kommer även att delta i större projekt, som migreringar och uppgraderingar av databaser och applikationsplattformar. Arbetet sker i nära samarbete med kollegor inom drift, system och säkerhet, och med kunder som värdesätter långsiktighet och kvalitet.
 



  





**Krav** 




 🔹3-5 års erfarenhet av SQL Server – installation, konfiguration och administration
 



 🔹Felsökning och optimering av SQL-databaser
 



 🔹Backup och återställning av databaser
 



 🔹Grundläggande förståelse för datamodellering och säkerhet
 



**Meriterande:** 




 🔹Azure IaaS och PaaS och AWS
 



 🔹Windows Server, till exempel AD, PKI och RDS
 



 🔹Nätverksförståelse, t.ex. segmentering och VPN
 



 🔹Linuxmiljöer och backuplösningar
 



  





**Det här erbjuder vi** 




**Flexibilitet** 
 : Jobba halva veckan var du vill – hemma, på kontoret eller någon annanstans.
 



**Kollegorna** 
 : Här jobbar du med människor som kan sin sak och delar gärna med sig.
 



**Rätt storlek** 
 : Stora nog för att ge utveckling, små nog för att du ska göra skillnad.
 



**Teknikpeng** 
 : Du väljer utrustningen, vi står för notan.
 



**Utveckling** 
 : Vi gillar när du växer, testar nytt och utmanar oss.
 



**Bakgrundskontroll** 




 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomför vi bakgrundskontroller på de kandidater som är aktuella för anställning. Kontrollen görs först efter ditt samtycke

title: Data Engineer
description:
Some data problems are neat and tidy. Ours usually aren’t. They are messy, evolving, and tied to real decisions. We work closely with our clients to understand what actually needs to be solved and build from there.
 



 At Playground Data, we build modern data platforms for analytics, AI and machine learning. We are a collaborative team that values solid engineering and shared growth. Our engineers take ownership and work closely with clients to deliver high-quality solutions.
 


 What you'll actually do
 
 You’ll work closely with our clients on high-impact initiatives where data is critical to the business. Many of our engagements involve greenfield builds or major platform transformations. This role suits engineers who enjoy creating structure from complexity and taking end-to-end ownership.
   

  

**In practice, you’ll:** 



* Design and build modern data platforms from scratch.
* Ingest, model, and structure data so it’s usable for analytics, AI and ML workloads.
* Work close to production, with growing responsibility for operating, evolving, and improving platforms over time.
* Contribute internally by improving how we work, helping build and manage our data engineering frameworks, shaping our technical approaches, being part of presales and supporting Playground’s continued growth.



 You’ll never sit idle, there’s always something meaningful to build, improve, or untangle.
 


**Who are you?** 

 You’ve been building data platforms for a few years and know that data doesn’t magically organize itself. Python and SQL are part of your daily toolkit, and you’ve wrestled with at least one modern data stack (AWS, GCP, Databricks, Snowflake etc.) and lived to tell the tale.
 



 You would probably describe yourself as someone who:
 



**Understands data engineering in practice** 
 : You know how data needs to flow, scale, and hold up in production for analytics and AI and ML workloads.
 



**Enjoys building from scratch** 
 : Greenfield work doesn’t scare you, it motivates you.
 



**Stays calm when things are unclear** 
 : You don’t panic when requirements are fuzzy and the system diagram needs three whiteboards.
 



**Is comfortable in a consultant role** 
 : You handle customer dialogue well, can contribute in presales, and help guide clients through difficult decisions.
 



 As a person, you’re humble, genuinely curious about technology, and motivated, while knowing that asking for help is a strength, not a weakness. Friendly, curious, and playful.
 



 You must be based in the Stockholm area and have a valid work permit for Sweden (no visa sponsorship or relocation).
   

  

**Buzzword bingo:** 
 AWS, Azure, GCP, Databricks, Snowflake, DBT, Python, SQL, Terraform
 


 Language requirement
 

 Fluency in Swedish is a very-nice-to-have and English is a must. Why? Because
 
 most
 

 of our collaborations and client projects are conducted in Swedish.
 



 Welcome to Playground!
 
 At Playground, you work on real, complex assignments for well-established and ambitious clients, not bench projects or short-lived experiments. Our teams are trusted with production systems, platforms, and data that actually matter. Here growth comes from ownership, curiosity, and doing the work properly. You’re trusted to think, contribute, and keep getting better, one meaningful step at a time.
   

 Playground brings together specialized domains under one umbrella, with a shared culture and way of working, and easy access to broad technical expertise when it helps move the work forward.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Machine Learning is a growing business area for us, and we work closely with our clients to understand what actually needs to be solved, then design and build solutions that hold up in production, not just in theory.
 



 At Playground Data, we build modern data platforms for analytics, AI and machine learning. We are a collaborative team that values solid engineering and shared growth. Our engineers take ownership and work closely with clients to deliver high-quality solutions.
 


 What you'll actually do
 
 You’ll work closely with our clients to understand business problems - and help resolving these by working hands on with data. Your responsibilities will stretch from the early experimentation stage to stable, production-grade systems.
 



 The focus is true end-to-end ownership from problem framing and model design through deployment and ongoing reliability.
 
 Many of our engagements involve greenfield builds or major platform transformations.
 




**In practice, you’ll:** 



* Design, build, and train machine learning models, translating real needs into working ML solutions.
* Own deployment and runtime performance in production, ensuring models are stable, monitored, and continuously improved once live.
* Establish and maintain MLOps workflows.
* Contribute internally by improving how we work with machine learning, shaping our ML practices and tooling, supporting presales when relevant, and helping Playground grow this expanding area.




 You’ll never sit idle, there’s always something meaningful to build, improve, or untangle.
 



 Who are you?
 
 You bring at least a few years of hands-on experience in Machine Learning Engineering, and you’ve moved beyond prototypes into systems that actually run in production. Python is your core language, MLOps is a natural part of how you think, and you care just as much about deployment and operation as you do about model performance.
 



 You would probably describe yourself as someone who:
 



**Is technically-sound:** 
 Except for strong Python skills, you have hands-on experience with ML frameworks (e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow, or scikit-learn). And are comfortable in the cloud (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
 



**Thinks beyond the model:** 
 You know a good model is only half the job. You consider data quality, drift, monitoring, retraining, and how systems behave once they’re live.
 



**Keeps calm when things are unclear:** 
 Business problems are rarely perfectly framed. You’re comfortable navigating uncertainty, iterating on hypotheses, and creating structure where there isn’t any yet.
 



 As a person, you’re humble, genuinely curious about technology, and motivated, while knowing that asking for help is a strength, not a weakness. Friendly, curious, and playful.
 



 You must be based in the Stockholm area and have a valid work permit for Sweden (no visa sponsorship or relocation).
   

  

**Buzzword bingo:** 
 AWS, Azure, GCP, Python, PyTorch, TensorFlow, scikit-learn, MLOps, Terraform, Docker
 


 Language requirement
 
 Fluency in Swedish is a very-nice-to-have and English is a must. Why? Because most of our collaborations and client projects are conducted in Swedish.
 


 Welcome to Playground!
 
 At Playground, you work on real, complex assignments for well-established and ambitious clients, not bench projects or short-lived experiments. Our teams are trusted with production systems, platforms, and data that actually matter. Here growth comes from ownership, curiosity, and doing the work properly. You’re trusted to think, contribute, and keep getting better, one meaningful step at a time.
 



 Playground brings together specialized domains under one umbrella, with a shared culture and way of working, and easy access to broad technical expertise when it helps move the work forward.

title: Software & Service Analyst
description:
Har du en förmåga att se affärsmöjligheter i komplex data? Motiveras du av att förvandla rådata till strategiska insikter och konkreta rekommendationer som vinner affärer?
   

  

 Jag heter Urban Jansson och är Head of CX |Method |SW & Service. Nu söker jag en Software & Service Analyst. Din roll blir att vara den analytiska motorn bakom våra mest strategiska affärer. Du förser våra specialister och kundteam med den "intelligence" som krävs för att bygga framtidens IT-lösningar.
   

  

**Vad kommer du att göra i rollen:**
* Datadriven beslutsstöd: Analysera kundernas befintliga mjukvaru- och tjänsteportföljer för att identifiera optimeringsmöjligheter, risker och tillväxtpotential.
* Framtagande av Business Case: Skapa de ekonomiska och tekniska underlag (TCO/ROI-analyser) som specialisterna behöver för att motivera EA- (Enterprise Agreement) och Service-upplägg.
* Trend- & Lifecycle-analys: Monitorera trender inom AI, automation och mjukvara för att proaktivt rekommendera nästa steg i kundens livscykel.
* Stöd vid RFI/RFP: Leverera djupanalys och underlag som utgör ryggraden i våra vinnande anbud samt delta i kundmöten.
* Analys av partnerprogram: Bryta ner komplexa programvillkor från våra strategiska partners till begripliga modeller för hur vi maximerar kundnytta och lönsamhet.
* Modellering enligt LAER: Fokusera på analysen som stöttar "Land"-fasen, men även identifiera triggers för "Expand" och "Renew".


**Vem samarbetar du med:**
* Du är den centrala länken i vårt team av mjukvaru- & service-specialister där du fungerar som deras "analytical partner".
* Du översätter komplex teknik och data till affärsvärde för våra affärs- och kundteam i alla regioner.
* Du har en tät dialog med våra strategiska partners för att förstå deras datamodeller och licensstrukturer.


**För att lyckas i rollen:**
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är en person som älskar att "gräva där du står". Du har erfarenhet av dataanalys, kalkylering och teknisk design, gärna med fokus på mjukvara och tjänster.
   

  

* Analytiskt mindset: Du ser mönster där andra ser brus och kan omvandla komplexa dataset till tydliga rekommendationer.
* Verktygsvana: Du är skicklig på att arbeta med datadrivna insikter (ex. CS-data, Excel, BI-verktyg eller CRM-data) för att bygga beslutsunderlag.
* Kommunikativ analytiker: Du kan paketera dina insikter i presentationer som är lätta för både tekniker och beslutsfattare att förstå.
* Strukturerad arkitekt: Du har ett öga för detaljer men tappar aldrig bort det affärsmässiga helhetsperspektivet.


 Körkort och excellenta kunskaper i Office 365 är ett skallkrav. Även möjlighet att delta i aktiveter över hela Sverige under arbetsveckorna är viktigt.
   

  

**Varför Telia Cygate?**
 På Telia Cygate är vi inte bara experter på nätverk, säkerhet och olika slags moln – vi är också ett gäng som tycker att det ska vara kul att gå till jobbet! Som en del av Telia Company har vi styrkan att skapa verklig påverkan i stor skala, bidra till samhällsnytta och hjälpa våra kunder att navigera i digitaliseringens värld. Vi gör det alltid med värme, omtanke och ett leende. Här är det idéerna och våra olika perspektiv som gör oss starka, och tillsammans ser vi till att teknikens värld blir en plats där alla trivs – och där du hör hemma.
   

  

 Hos oss är din utveckling viktig. Vi uppmuntrar till kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och ser till att just du och dina intressen är i fokus. Vi vet att det är människorna som utgör vårt företag, och därför värdesätter vi glädje, kreativitet och olika perspektiv i allt vi gör.
   

  

 Välkommen att växa tillsammans med oss, där vi gör teknik mänsklig och skapar verklig påverkan
 **!**
**Vad vi erbjuder**
 När du börjar hos oss får du ett omfattande förmånspaket anpassat efter din lokala marknad, möjlighet till hybridarbete och mer. Du har också chans att få bonus baserat på din prestation och Telias resultat.
   

  

**Låter det intressant?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan senast
 **2026-03-29.** 
 Rollen kan komma att stängas tidigare om vi hittar rätt kandidat – så vänta inte för länge!
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm eller Göteborg
   

  

 Om du går vidare i processen kommer du att kontaktas av vår
 **Talent Acquisition Partner** 
 . Bakgrund- och referenskontroller ingår i processen.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer om rollen?** 
 Kontakta gärna Urban Jansson på urban.jansson@cygate.se
   

  

**Lika möjligheter för alla**
 På Telia värderar vi kompetens och utvecklingspotential. Vi främjar mångfald och ser till att varje individs behov tillgodoses, oavsett funktionsvariation, kön, ålder, nationalitet, sexuell läggning eller social bakgrund. Tillsammans skapar vi en inkluderande arbetsmiljö där din unikhet är vår styrka.
   

  

**Välkommen till Telia Cygate – Home of Experts**

title: Junior Project Manager - Digital Compliance
description:
Junior Project Manager – Digital Compliance
   

  

 Location: Stockholm Employment Type: Full-time
   

  

**About The Role**
 Are you passionate about driving compliance in a rapidly evolving digital landscape? We are looking for a Junior Project Manager – Digital Compliance to lead cross-functional projects ensuring our products, services, and operations comply with key European Union/ Global digital regulations such as NIS2, GDPR, Cyber Resilience Act (CRA), DORA, AI Act, Data Act, other Cyber security regulations from different regions etc..
   

  

 This role requires close collaboration with legal, product, cybersecurity, business, and digital teams across global locations. You will play a critical part in driving regulatory compliance initiatives that will further safeguard our business and customers.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Lead & manage digital compliance projects focused on EU/global legislative mandates
* Maintain project documentation, dashboards, and provide executive updates to stakeholders.
* Translate complex EU/global regulatory requirements into clear technical and operational project execution plans.
* Collaborate with legal, product, R&D, IT, and cybersecurity teams to assess compliance gaps and define remediation paths.
* Coordinate and drive audits, readiness assessments, and regulatory submissions.
* Support development of compliance frameworks, internal policies, and process improvements.
* Monitor regulatory developments and proactively evaluate their impact on product roadmaps.
* Support vendor assessments and third-party engagements for compliance-related tools or consultancy.


**Required Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering, Law, Information Security, Cybersecurity, or IT.
* 2 to 4 years of project-management experience, leading cybersecurity or digital compliance initiatives.
* Strong knowledge of EU/global regulatory landscape in at least 3 areas: GDPR, NIS2, CRA, AI Act, Data Ac/other global Cybersecurity regulations
* Experience in hardware or connected device industries (Digital Acces, Security, IoT, electronics, embedded systems).
* Experience working with cross-functional and cross-border teams in matrix organizations.
* Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills at both technical and executive levels.
* Fluent in English; additional European languages are a plus.


**Preferred Experience**
* Security product development, access control systems, smart locks, connected security devices, or IoT security platforms.
* Familiarity with compliance automation tools, product security frameworks, and CE marking processes.
* Experience working with regulators, notified bodies, or standardization committees.
* Understanding of supply chain security and secure-by-design principles.
* Project Management certifications (e.g., PMP, PRINCE2, AgilePM) and familiarity with Agile/Waterfall/hybrid delivery.


 What We Offer
   

  

 We provide fantastic opportunities and benefits to help you build and grow a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Opportunities for learning and development
* A rewarding workplace with strong engagement
* Working in a great team in a dynamic environment
* Attractive collective agreement
* A competitive salary


**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Strategic Business Analyst
description:
Are you enthusiastic about being part of shaping the future of our Account product offering? Join Swedbank’s Account Products Team as a Strategic Business Analyst.
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Join a highly skilled team responsible for the Payment & Account products at Swedbank.
* Work in a dynamic product area with a lot of opportunities to learn and grow.
* Drive and support the development of corporate and private account product offering.
* Lead end-to-end requirements gathering for new and enhanced account products.
* Analyze business needs, customer insights, market trends, and process gaps.
* Translate business objectives into clear, actionable functional requirements and user stories.
* Ensure business requirements are well-understood, testable, and aligned with regulatory and internal standards.
* Work cross-functionally with teams across the bank, contributing to project planning and implementation.
* Collaborate closely with Product Owners, Product specialists, IT teams and other stakeholders to gather and translate business needs into clear requirements.


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* Demonstrated experience from the financial sector, preferably from Cash Management or daily banking products.
* Understanding of product lifecycle management and advantage to have experience from agile methodologies.
* Proven experience of as a Business Analyst or Product Specialist in banking or financial services.
* Solid experience translating business needs into detailed requirements.
* Experience from implementation of regulatory requirements (ie PSD2) in financial sector would be considered a merit.
* The ability to take a client centric perspective to understand how business requirement will impact customer journey.
* Experience working in Agile environments and familiarity with tools like Jira or Confluence is a plus.
* Excellent stakeholder management, communication, and self-initiative skills.
* Analytical skills, attention to details, and a problem-solving mindset.
* Capability to deliver in a changing and fast-moving environment.
* To be a great team player and have a structured way of working.
* Great communication skills in English and Swedish.
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field, or a great reason for not having one.


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.


 "Join our team and...
   

  

 be a part of a team of professionals, who are jointly delivering on prioritised initiatives and to maximize customer value."
 **Helena Ölander Wettergren, your future manager**
 We look forward to receiving your application by 10.03.2026.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sundbyberg
   

  

**Recruiting manager:** 
 Helena Ölander Wettergren
   

  

 We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.
   

  

*We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.*
**Swedbank does not discriminate to anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.**

title: Creative Strategist
description:
Operations
   

  

* Stockholm


 Creative Strategist
   

  

***Cure Media is the leading influencer marketing agency in the Nordics, awarded as the Influencer Marketing Agency of the Year and ranked as the 3rd best tech platform globally.***
***We deliver measurable results to world-class brands such as L'Oréal, Sephora and Intersport.***
 We are experiencing a bright future and want to talk to you if you are passionate, driven, and want to join our journey to become the leading choice for brands and influencers across Europe. We are now looking for a
 **Creative Strategist** 
 to come join our Creative team!
   

  

**What We Offer**
* The possibility to work with one of the fastest-growing and most successful marketing methods globally.
* To work with global brands and leading tech solutions for influencer marketing.
* Become part of a passionate and high-performing team.
* Cure Media is working with thousands of influencers in several markets such as Sweden and the Nordics but also in Germany and UK.


**About Creative Strategist**
 Are you the person who always spots the next trend
 *before* 
 it’s everywhere? Do you think in campaign concepts, moodboards, and enjoy making the idea come to life? Cure Media is looking for a
 **Creative Strategist** 
 to help shape influencer marketing campaigns that drive cultural relevance and brand results.
   

  

 Your mission is to ensure that our clients’ creative influencer activations are well executed and creatively sharp – from A to Z. You will be part of the Creative Team, a group of specialist roles supporting client teams with creative ideation and execution of creator campaigns. The team currently consists of three roles: Creative Lead, Creative Strategist, and UGC Specialist. You will also work closely with creative functions such as the Trends & Insights Manager and Event & PR Specialist.
   

  

**Your Tasks & Responsibilities**
* Drive creative ideation and concept development for influencer activation across verticals like lifestyle, fashion, beauty, food, family, and more.
* Daily work includes collaborating within various client teams across multiple categories, including beauty, sport, and food.
* Manage the creative process from concept to delivery with strong self-leadership skills.
* Scout suppliers, locations, and participate in on-site creative direction during shoots, or recordings.
* Participate in client meetings and pitch ideas and concepts.
* Staying up-to-date and well-read on social media, marketing trends and consumer behavior.
* Create presentations, one-pagers, moodboards, and visualization of creative ideas.


**Who You Are**
* 3+ years of experience in a creative role within content, social media and marketing.
* We believe your background is rooted in a creative agency or a modern B2C brand, working with both idea development and creative execution.
* A strong understanding of how brands connect with audiences on Instagram, TikTok, and beyond, including platform trends and algorithms.
* You have the ability to coordinate between internal client teams and suppliers and making sure every creative detail is executed flawlessly.
* Strong visual storytelling skills, you know how to make a deck sing and sell an idea.
* Confidence in working with budgets, logistics and external partners.
* A team player with drive, energy and a love for making things happen.
* You speak and write fluently in Swedish and English.


**Other Perks & Benefits**
* Insurance and pension plan
* 6 weeks paid vacation per year & 5 000 sek/year in employee wellness subsidy
* MacBook and iPhone.
* Annual conference trips (we’ve been to places like New York, Barcelona, and London).


**Start** 
 : ASAP (full-time)
   

  

**Hours:** 
 Full-time
   

  

**Location & Reporting:** 
 You’ll be based in Stockholm as part of our Stockholm office and you will report to Creative Lead.
   

  

 Do you have any questions about the role, the career development opportunities, or something else? Don't be a stranger, feel free to reach out!
   

  

 Please note that the application should be in English.
   

  

 If you have a portfolio or relevant work samples, you’re welcome to include them in your application.
   

  

 Department Operations Role Creative Strategist Locations Stockholm
   

  

 Colleagues
   

  

 Carlos Casquilho
   

  

 Account Director Lead
   

  

 Nanna Selén
   

  

 Creative Strategist
   

  

 Anna Litzén
   

  

 Trends & Insights Manager

* Campaign Coordinator - Full time Operations
* Stockholm
* Campaign Coordinator with a focus on sport & gaming - Part time Operations
* Stockholm
* Hybrid
* Campaign Coordinator with a focus on food - Part time Operations
* Stockholm
* Hybrid


 More jobs
   

  

 Stockholm
   

  

 What about perks and benefits?
   

  

* Shared success


 We want everyone to have a share in our future success. Therefore we offer our employees a generous stock option plan, aligning everyone towards our shared goals and future achievements.
   

  

* Great development opportunities


 Since we are a fast-growing company in a fast-moving industry, our employees have great opportunities to evolve, both on a personal level as well as on their career path. Everyone is encouraged to nurture their individual talents and develop within areas they are passionate about.
   

  

* Fun at work


 We believe in celebrating our achievements and building strong team bonds. That’s why we organize bi-annual conference trips to exciting locations like Marbella, Barcelona, and London! Additionally, we have regular after-work events where we can unwind and enjoy each other's company.
   

  

* Reward and recognition


 We celebrate our successes and believe in rewarding hard work. We offer extra vacation days, competitive health packages, and generous pension plans to ensure our team stays healthy and happy.
   

  

 How's life at Cure Media?
   

  

 Our values—result-focused, brave, and passionate—are at the core of everything we do. Working at Cure Media is an exciting, evolving, and challenging experience. We strive to be the best in influencer marketing, and that requires dedication and a commitment to excellence.
   

  

 We pride ourselves not only on our industry-leading work but also on our vibrant company culture. From our renowned happy hour events to our supportive and energetic workplace, we cultivate a “can-do” attitude, serve great coffee, and prioritize being there for each other and our customers.
   

  

**About Cure Media**
 Cure Media is a leading independent Influencer Marketing company with global reach, focusing on the fashion, home, beauty and FMCG. We build successful influencer strategies for marketing teams and run campaigns with influencers on social platforms such as Instagram, TikTok and YouTube. Some of our clients are L'Oréal, Sephora, Kappahl and Wolt.
   

  

 Cure Media was awarded as the “Agency of the Year 2022” at the Influencer Marketing Summit. We've also been awarded “Best Large Influencer Marketing Agency” and “Best Influencer Marketing Platform” two years in a row at Global Influencer Marketing Awards. Additionally, we are certified by IAB as a Qualified Influencer Marketing Partner.
   

  

 Founded in 2014

title: Software Engineer - Solutions Engineering
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

 Help us shape the future of open source IT, devops, and IS, from bare metal to containers. Our goal is to revolutionise open source application and infrastructure operations.
   

  

 We want to transform the world of software operations by enabling true model-driven operations via next-generation infrastructure-as-code. This will allow companies to run very efficient bare-metal operations for high-performance computing, private cloud, data lakes, AI/ML, and analytics. We need to invent some new technology, and we need to build some new products; we are therefore looking for someone who can lead and inspire a regional software engineering team to fulfill this initiative.
   

  

 The Solutions Engineering team works in close collaboration with our managed infrastructure operations team, which runs many private OpenStack clouds and Kubernetes clusters for customers around the world. This enables us to improve our infra-as-code products based on our own real experience, mirroring that of our users and customers. We work in Python, creating open source automation capabilities that simplify operations for anybody, anywhere, who is building on Ubuntu.
   

  

 Most of the team's work involves pure Python software development focused on enabling true DevOps workflows. We strive for high quality in both design, documentation, tests, and performance as we enhance operations code packages and Ubuntu itself in order to ensure our platform is the easiest, most robust, and best performing for driving your infrastructure.
   

  

 This role is ideal for software engineers who want to work in a global team, have a passion for distributed systems and cloud computing, and an interest in the entire Linux stack - from kernel to networking to virtualization and containers.
   

  

 What you will do
   

  

* Work in Python and Golang to design and deliver open source software operations code
* Work with the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications
* Shape high quality open source monitoring and alerting infrastructure
* Rethink open source operations for our customers and open source community
* Demonstrate sound engineering design and testing principles in your code
* Follow agile software development practices
* Coach and develop your colleagues where you have insights
* Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values
* Global travel up to 10% of time for internal and external events


 Who you are
   

  

* You are a passionate Python developer
* You are organised and want your team to deliver timely, high quality software
* You understand the importance of reliable operations in an agile world
* You have sound knowledge of cloud computing concepts & technologies
* You have practical knowledge of Linux and networking
* You are a lifelong learner


 Bonus points for
   

  

* You have graduated with a university degree in Computer Science or related software engineering field
* Golang programming skills


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Data Engineer
description:
*Kreditz is transforming how businesses assess credit and risk using real-time data and NextGen Credit Scoring solutions.*
*As one of Europe’s fastest-growing FinTech scaleups - we’ve earned a place on the* 
***Sifted 100: Nordics & Benelux***
*list in both 2024 and 2025 and most recently, we were proud to receive a* 
***double win at the Credit Management & Compliance Awards 2025***
*, being named both "* 
***Fintech Rocket of the Year***
*" and "* 
***Breakthrough of the Year***
*".*
*With strong growth across the Nordics and Europe, our clients range from leading banks and iGaming giants to fast-moving digital innovators.*
**About The Position**
*At Kreditz, data is not just a support function, it is the core of our product. We turn raw bank transactions into real-time insight that powers credit & risk decisions across Europe.*
*As we scale, we’re strengthening our data foundation and building a modern, reliable, and cost-efficient data platform. We’re now looking for a Data Engineer to join our Product team and take ownership of our Data Warehouse, pipelines, and reporting enablement across the business.*
*This is a hands-on role for someone who loves building scalable data infrastructure and wants to work close to both product and real business impact.*
*Your mission is to build and evolve a scalable, reliable, and high-performing data environment that supports both analytics and operational needs.*
**What Can Kreditz Offer**
* A once-in-a-lifetime growth journey, from startup to Global scaleup
* A journey where everyone in the team plays a crucial role for our company’s success
* Fun-loving, driven, and passionate colleagues who support each other’s success
* A culture that celebrates progress, humility, and teamwork
* We win together
* 24/7 access to gym, sauna and sports facilities at our office, plus additional wellness allowance
* Competitive base salary


**RESPONSIBILITES**
**Some Of The Main Responsibilities You Will Cover**
* Maintain & Enhance the DWH: Own the architecture of our Data Warehouse, ensuring it is scalable, cost-effective, and optimized for both analytical and operational needs.
* Pipeline Automation: Design, build, and maintain robust ETL/ELT pipelines to ingest data from various sources into our AWS ecosystem. Work closely with our MLOPs Engineering team to assist the data pipelines for our AI / ML models
* Stakeholder Enablement: Work closely with Product, Finance, and Commercial teams to automate internal reporting and create self-service data environments.
* AWS Infrastructure: Leverage and manage AWS services (such as Glue, Redshift, Athena, Lambda, and S3) to ensure a high-performing data environment.
* Data Quality & Governance: Implement monitoring and validation frameworks to ensure data integrity and lineage across all systems.
* Collaborate: Partner with our DevOps and Backend teams to align infrastructure and ensure smooth data flow across the entire Kreditz platform.


**WE ARE LOOKING FOR**
 We focus on practical engineering skill, strong foundations, and the ability to build systems that last.
   

  

**In Addition To That We Believe You Have**
* BSc / MSc in a quantitative subject, i.e., Physics, Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science or equivalent.
* 3+ years of experience in Data Engineering or a similar role focused on data infrastructure.
* Expert-level SQL skills for complex transformations and performance tuning.
* Proficiency in Python for building pipelines and automating tasks.
* Strong hands-on experience with AWS (specifically services like Redshift/Snowflake, S3, Glue, and Lambda).
* Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts (e.g., Star Schema, Kimball) and modern data stack tools.
* Experience with orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, Dagster) and CI/CD workflows (i.e., GitHub Actions).
* Ability to translate complex technical data structures into clear insights for non-technical stakeholders.


**Meritorious Skills**
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform).
* Experience from FinTech, Open Banking, or working with highly regulated data.
* Familiarity with BI tools (e.g., AWS QuickSight, PowerBI...etc)


**WHY JOIN NOW?**
 At Kreditz, you’ll work with data that matters, powering real-time financial decisions across Europe. You’ll have real ownership, real impact, and the opportunity to shape the data foundation of a fast-growing FinTech scaleup.
   

  

**APPOINTMENT OF ROLE**
 Q2/Q3 2026
   

  

**SCOPE**
 Full-time, permanent employment (tillsvidareanställning)
   

  

**SALARY**
 Competitive salary
   

  

**REPORTING**
 You will be reporting to the company’s CPO
   

  

**WORKPLACE**
 Danderyd, Stockholm
   

  

**RECRUITMENT PROCESS**
 Ongoing selection, we review candidates continuously.
   

  

*Last day for applications 31st March*
**CRIMINAL RECORDS EXTRACT**
 As part of our recruitment process we will ask you to present a clean criminal records extract
   

  

**CONTACT**
 Lorenzo Puccio, VP Strategic Operations, Lorenzo@kreditz.com
   

  

 For more information about the role feel free to reach out to our CPO, Spilios Tzouras, spilios.tzouras@kreditz.com
   

  

 Intelligent credit- & risk decisions made easy with open banking & AI-technology

title: Software & Service Specialist
description:
Har du erfarenhet av att driva komplexa mjukvaruaffärer i en Customer Success-driven organisation? Motiveras du av att arbeta i affärsteam, lösa affärskritiska utmaningar och orkestrera vinnande anbud?
   

  

 Jag heter Urban Jansson och är Head of CX
 *|Method |SW & Service* 
 . Nu söker jag en Software & Service Specialist. Du blir en nyckelperson i våra affärsteam där du äger framtagandet av EA, mjukvaru- & service-design, offerter och avtal. Din roll är central för vår tillväxt och transformation, där du agerar bryggan mellan kundens behov och våra strategiska erbjudanden.
   

  

**Din nästa möjlighet?**
 Som Software & Service Specialist inom Lifecycle Selling är du den drivande kraften bakom våra största affärsmöjligheter inom mjukvara och service inklusive EA. Du ansvarar för att leda arbetet med lösningar, offerter och avtalsförhandlingar inom erbjudandet. Uppdraget är att stärka vår position som
 *trusted advisor* 
 genom att applicera vår Customer Lifecycle Success-metod genom hela kundresan.
   

  

 Du är djupt kunnig i vårt erbjudande och agerar expert på våra partners strategiska program. Tillsammans med respektive affärsteam driver du kundens utmaningar genom strategiska initiativ för att skapa nya affärsmöjligheter.
   

  

**Vad kommer du att göra i rollen:**
* Affärsdesign & Anbud: Leda arbetet inom RFI, RFQ & RFP som lösningsarkitekt inom EA, software och Service med fokus på affärsdesign, offert- och avtalsarbete.
* Kundledarskap: Vara den drivande experten i kundmöten och styra dialogen mot värdebaserad försäljning.
* Strategiskt stöd: Agera stöd till affärsutveckling inom CS-affären, EA-upplägg och Service-modeller.
* Designansvar: Ansvara för design av mjukvaru- och servicelösningar kopplat till utpekade strategiska partners samt avtalsframtagande.
* Tillväxtfokus: Driva försäljning och expansion på befintliga konton genom att identifiera nästa steg i kundens livscykel.
* Transformationsledare: Leda förflyttningen mot mjukvarustyrda lösningar, AI och automation för att säkra kundens IT-plattform.
* Metodarbete: Arbeta enligt LAER-metoden med särskilt fokus på "Land"-fasen för att lägga grunden för långsiktiga samarbeten.


**Vem samarbetar du med:**
* Du är en bärande del i vårt centrala team av SW & Service Specialister.
* Du agerar expertkompetens och lösningsansvarig för mjukvaru- och servicedesign i affärsteam över alla regioner.
* Du driver samarbetet med våra viktigaste partners för att ständigt ligga i framkant gällande portföljuppdateringar och marknadsförändringar.


**För att lyckas i rollen:**
 För att lyckas ser vi att du har en gedigen bakgrund inom Customer Success och försäljning ur ett design- och tjänsteperspektiv för mjukvara och service samt avtalsförhandling. Du har stor erfarenhet av kundpresentationer och förhandlingar.
   

  

* Affärsmässig arkitekt: Du har förmågan att förvandla teknisk design och kalkylering till vinnande affärsförslag.
* Datadriven beslutsfattare: Du kan dra nytta av komplexa insikter och analysunderlag för att bygga starka business cases.
* Skicklig förhandlare: Du är en erfaren avtalsförhandlare som trivs i komplexa affärsdialoger.
* Orkestratör: Du är samarbetsinriktad och van vid att leda tvärfunktionella resurser över hela företaget och hos partners.
* Kommunikatör: Du genomför presentationer och workshops med lätthet och pondus på ledningsnivå.


 Körkort och excellenta kunskaper i Office 365 är ett skallkrav. Även möjlighet att delta i aktiveter över hela Sverige under arbetsveckorna är viktigt.
   

  

**Varför Telia Cygate?**
 På Telia Cygate är vi inte bara experter på nätverk, säkerhet och olika slags moln – vi är också ett gäng som tycker att det ska vara kul att gå till jobbet! Som en del av Telia Company har vi styrkan att skapa verklig påverkan i stor skala, bidra till samhällsnytta och hjälpa våra kunder att navigera i digitaliseringens värld. Vi gör det alltid med värme, omtanke och ett leende. Här är det idéerna och våra olika perspektiv som gör oss starka, och tillsammans ser vi till att teknikens värld blir en plats där alla trivs – och där du hör hemma.
   

  

 Hos oss är din utveckling viktig. Vi uppmuntrar till kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och ser till att just du och dina intressen är i fokus. Vi vet att det är människorna som utgör vårt företag, och därför värdesätter vi glädje, kreativitet och olika perspektiv i allt vi gör.
   

  

 Välkommen att växa tillsammans med oss, där vi gör teknik mänsklig och skapar verklig påverkan
 **!**
**Vad vi erbjuder**
 När du börjar hos oss får du ett omfattande förmånspaket anpassat efter din lokala marknad, möjlighet till hybridarbete och mer. Du har också chans att få bonus baserat på din prestation och Telias resultat.
   

  

**Låter det intressant?**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan senast
 **2026-03-29.** 
 Rollen kan komma att stängas tidigare om vi hittar rätt kandidat – så vänta inte för länge!
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm eller Göteborg
   

  

 Om du går vidare i processen kommer du att kontaktas av vår
 **Talent Acquisition Partner** 
 . Bakgrund- och referenskontroller ingår i processen.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer om rollen?** 
 Kontakta gärna Urban Jansson på urban.jansson@cygate.se
   

  

**Lika möjligheter för alla**
 På Telia värderar vi kompetens och utvecklingspotential. Vi främjar mångfald och ser till att varje individs behov tillgodoses, oavsett funktionsvariation, kön, ålder, nationalitet, sexuell läggning eller social bakgrund. Tillsammans skapar vi en inkluderande arbetsmiljö där din unikhet är vår styrka.
   

  

**Välkommen till Telia Cygate – Home of Experts**

title: Azure Infrastructure specialist
description:
**As a leading firm in audit, tax and advisory – and part of a global network of 364,000 professionals across 136 countries – we combine deep expertise with cutting-edge technology to deliver solutions that make a real difference. By bringing together experience and innovation, we help our clients become more efficient, adapt to change and stay ahead in a world that's constantly evolving. Join PwC – so you can help shape the organisations of tomorrow with us.**
**Are you our new colleague in IT?**
 As Azure Infrastructure specialist you will be the union of people, processes and technology to create added value. You will be a part of a Cloud & Platform team of 6 colleagues that supports our development teams and you will work with design, implementation, transformation, operation, DR/backup, support and optimization. A part of your role will also be to hold presentations on a detailed level to developers and on a more basic level to e.g. our board.
   

  

**Your main tasks as Azure Infrastructure specialist**
* Azure operation/development (Local & Global)
* Automation CI/DC, Terraform
* Azure AKS
* Manage processes regarding Disaster Recovery (DR) and backup/restore
* Be responsible for security related configurations/implementations regarding to Azure
* Be involved in different projects as Azure Specialist
* Writing documentation (Way Of Workings) för Azure platforms
* Help different Product-teams to succeed in their Azure deployments


**Requirements For The Role**
 To perform well in this role we believe that you already are working within cloud technology today and that you may also have a background as a specialist in at least one infrastructure technique. We are looking for you who has:
   

  

* Approximately 5-10 years’ experience in a related capacity
* Work experience in various Infrastructure related positions and techniques
* Know how to work in MS Azure
* Comfortable regarding Disaster Recovery in Azure environment for critical applications
* Proficiency in English and preferably understand Swedish
* Microsoft365
* Automation process in cloud operations, scripting, Terraform
* Storage, Network, Security, Virtualization


**We Think You Have Certifications Corresponding To The Following**
* MS Azure Administrator AZ-104
* MS Azure Developer AZ-305
* MS Azure DevOps AZ-400


 ,
   

  

**Recruitment Process**
 We will review applications continuously, and the position may be filled earlier than the application deadline.
   

  

**Please Attach The Following Documents To Your Application**
* CV


 We believe in having a recruitment process that applies to everyone. As part of the selection, we use psychometric tests to ensure an objective, unbiased, and fair selection.
   

  

 We value the personal meeting to understand the value you can bring to PwC and what we can offer you. The interview process usually consists of multiple stages and various types of interviews. When meeting with HR, you will have a competency-based interview where we examine the personality test you completed before the interview. During the interview with the business, you will have the opportunity to meet with the relevant team to discuss the role. We call for interviews continuously, and we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.
   

  

 For questions about the job or the recruitment process, contact the responsible recruiter below.

title: Production Assistant to H&M Studio
description:
**Job Description**

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**




 Do you want to play a key role behind the scenes and help bring H&M’s fashion content to life every day? H&M Studios, part of the H&M Marketing department, produces fashion content for H&M’s full assortment globally, with a focus on e-commerce. Our work includes model images, product images, and video assets.
 **As a Production Assistant** 
 , you play a central role in managing one of the largest wardrobes in the nordics, ensuring that every product is prepared, organised and presented in the best possible way for our shoots. This is a hands-on, fast paced role where your structured approach, attention to detail and proactive mindset directly support a smooth and efficient production process.
   

  





 Key responsibilities include:
   

  




* Unpacking, labeling, and sorting incoming products with accuracy and care.
* Maintaining an organised and up to date wardrobe area.
* Planning and executing steaming and ironing to ensure all garments are camera-ready.
* Supporting the production teams before and after photo shoots as well as assist during model photo shoots.
* Ensuring the studios are well prepared and ready to support daily production needs.



  

  

**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH**
  

  

  

 You will collaborate closely with fellow Production Assistants, Product Coordinators and Stylists, to name a few.
