title: Account Solution Engineer - Automotive/Manufacturing - SWE
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*

Job Category


Sales
Job Details


**About Salesforce**

Salesforce is the #1 AI CRM, where humans with agents drive customer success together. Here, ambition meets action. Tech meets trust. And innovation isn’t a buzzword — it’s a way of life. The world of work as we know it is changing and we're looking for Trailblazers who are passionate about bettering business and the world through AI, driving innovation, and keeping Salesforce's core values at the heart of it all.


Ready to level-up your career at the company leading workforce transformation in the agentic era? You’re in the right place! Agentforce is the future of AI, and you are the future of Salesforce.


**What is an Account Solution Engineer?**  

  

Also known as a “Presales”, “Solution Advisor”, “Sales Consultant,” or “Sales Engineer” the Account Solution Engineer is responsible for owning the solutions throughout the sales cycle and delivering thought leadership to companies to transform their customer’s experience. The Solution Engineer is an expert who works alongside their colleagues, participates in building our team culture and supports their aligned sales team to create solutions for prospects and customers.
  

To accomplish this, you should have a strong desire to set the vision translating business objectives into enticing and practical recommendations. The Solution Engineer acts as a trusted advisor to our customers while aiding the customer’s transformational journey.  



  

**Responsibilities**

* **Strategic Customer Engagement** : Partner with sales teams to drive digital transformation initiatives for automotive and manufacturing enterprises, positioning Salesforce as the platform for the agentic enterprise where AI agents work alongside humans to drive business outcomes
* **Solution Architecture & Design** : Lead technical discovery sessions to understand complex business processes across manufacturing operations, supply chain, dealer networks, and customer experience, translating requirements into comprehensive Salesforce solutions spanning across the portfolio
* **Agentic AI Evangelism** : Demonstrate and articulate how Agentforce and autonomous AI agents can transform customer-facing and internal operations—from intelligent service agents handling customer inquiries to autonomous SDR agents qualifying leads and autonomous sales coaches optimizing rep performance
* **Value-Based Selling** : Build and present compelling business cases that connect technical solutions to measurable business outcomes, focusing on revenue growth through platform expansion, cross-cloud opportunities, and demonstrating clear ROI
* **Demo/Workshop/Proof of Concept Execution** : Design and deliver impactful demonstrations, customer workshops and POCs that showcase the art of the possible, that drives operational efficiency in automotive/manufacturing contexts
* **Trusted Advisor Relationship Building** : Establish yourself as a strategic technology advisor to C-level and senior technical stakeholders, understanding their industry challenges around lead-to-cash, connected products, dealer management, warranty management, and evolving customer expectations
* **Platform Expansion & Land-and-Expand Strategy** : Identify opportunities to expand Salesforce footprint within existing accounts by uncovering new use cases across departments and business units, driving NNAOV through strategic platform growth
* **Collaboration & Knowledge Sharing** : Work closely with product specialists, industry advisors, architects, and customer success teams to ensure seamless handoffs and contribute to the broader solution engineering community through knowledge sharing and best practice documentation

**Key Attributes & Experience**

* **Solution Engineering Excellence** : Proven track record as a pre-sales solution engineer, sales engineer, or technical consultant successfully supporting complex software sales cycles
* **Business Acumen** : Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business value rather than just technical features, with experience building business cases, ROI models, and value realization frameworks that resonate with executive buyers
* **Growth Mindset** : Intellectual curiosity and commitment to continuous learning in a rapidly evolving technology landscape, particularly around AI/ML, data platforms, and industry-specific innovations
* **Customer-Centric** : Consultative approach with exceptional listening skills and the ability to ask insightful discovery questions that uncover both stated and unstated customer needs
* **AI & Automation Fluency** : Understanding of how artificial intelligence, machine learning, and autonomous agents are reshaping business processes, with ability to translate technical AI capabilities into business outcomes
* **Communication skills** : Polished communication and presentation skills with the confidence to engage C-suite executives, technical architects, and operational managers alike, adapting your message and medium to each audience
* **Collaborative Team Player** : Experience working in matrix organizations, partnering effectively with account executives, customer success managers, product teams, technical architects as well as external partners to drive customer outcomes
* **Language Skills** : Professional English proficiency required. Salesforce company language is English incl. corporate communication and meetings.
* **Proven Track Record** : History of meeting or exceeding sales quotas through technical contribution, with metrics demonstrating impact on win rates, deal size, and sales cycle velocity

**Preferred Skills and Experience**

* **Industry Expertise** : Experience in automotive or manufacturing sectors, with understanding of industry-specific challenges e.g dealer network management, connected vehicle services, aftermarket operations, supply chain complexity, and the shift toward electric and autonomous vehicles
* Prior experience in Engineering, Computer Science, MIS, ERP or equivalent fields.
* Hands-on experience with Salesforce platform configuration, including exposure to Flow, Lightning Web Components, or Apex development
* Previous experience and/or certification in Salesforce solutions such as Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Field Service, Revenue Cloud, B2B Commerce.
* Understanding of modern data architecture concepts including data lakes, real-time integration, API management, and master data management
* Experience with AI/ML platforms, prompt engineering, or implementing intelligent automation solutions
* Knowledge of automotive industry standards and protocols (e.g., STAR, CDK, DMS systems, telematics platforms)
* Exposure to MuleSoft, Tableau, or other Salesforce ecosystem products
* Experience with value engineering methodologies, business case development tools, or value realization frameworks
* Previous experience selling or implementing large-scale ERP, CRM, or digital transformation platforms (SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics)
* Understanding of European data privacy regulations (GDPR) and automotive industry compliance requirements
* Project management or Agile methodology certifications
* Experience in presenting and hosting webinars or public speaking..
* Active participation in Salesforce community, Trailhead accomplishments, or speaking engagements at industry events
* Fluent in English + Right to work in Sweden

Unleash Your Potential


When you join Salesforce, you’ll be limitless in all areas of your life. Our benefits and resources support you to find balance and *be your best* , and our AI agents accelerate your impact so you can *do your best* . Together, we’ll bring the power of Agentforce to organizations of all sizes and deliver amazing experiences that customers love. Apply today to not only shape the future — but to redefine what’s possible — for yourself, for AI, and the world.


Accommodations


If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .


Posting Statement


Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.
company_description: Salesforce is the #1 AI CRM, helping companies become Agentic Enterprises where humans and AI agents drive customer success together on one trusted, unified platform.

title: Receptionist Scandic Star Sollentuna
description:
\*\*Scandic Star Sollentuna\*\* ligger enbart ett par steg ifrån Sollentunas pendeltågsstation och 17 minuter till city. Vi har möjlighet att låta 500 gäster äta, konferera och sova under samma tak, vilket gör hotellet till den perfekta platsen för stora möten och kongresser. Hos oss arbetar du i en flexibel miljö där du möter många olika gäster, allt från business till barnfamiljer. Här erbjuder vi dig en spännande och fartfylld arbetsplats med härliga kollegor! Älskar du möten lika mycket som oss? Då är du den vi söker!


**Nu söker vi en Receptionist till Scandic Star Sollentuna.**



Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Du agerar värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.



Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad är innebär rollen?**



Du som arbetar i receptionen är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Ser till att gästens önskemål uppfylls. Du har alltid ett leende på läpparna och en kreativ lösning i bakfickan. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. Din arbetsplats är vår lobby. För det är där du möter flest gäster. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning.


Arbetet i receptionen innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet. Allt arbete sker med gästnöjdhet och försäljning i fokus.


Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och det är därför viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta i skift (förmiddagar, eftermiddagar och helger).


**Vem är du?**



För att passa i rollen tror vi att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster.



Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.


Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.


Allra viktigast är dock dina personliga egenskaper och din inställning. För att passa i rollen behöver du vara en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.


**Kvalifikationer:**



Du ska ha fyllt 20 år.



Du ska ha erfarenhet av arbete i ett serviceyrke, helst hotellreception.



Det är meriterande om du har jobbat med bokningssystem, tex Opera Cloud och i M365.


**Information om tjänsten**


**Tjänsten är en visstidsanställning på deltid med start i mars fram till augusti, med eventuell möjlighet till förlängning.**



Vi tillämpar provanställning. Din närmsta chef kommer att vara vår Front Office Manager. Platsen omfattar dagskift, kvällsskift både vardagar och helger.


Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!



Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------

Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

Enable "functional cookies" to watch the video


...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.
...under 2014 inledde ett samarbete med organisationen Real Stars, centrerat kring ”Fair Sex”, dvs. arbete mot människo- och sexhandel.
company_description: Nordiskt hotellföretag i världsklass som skapar enastående upplevelser för de många människorna. 16 000 medarbetar, 280 hotell i 6 länder.

title: Technical Lead (AI & Automation ) - SKF Automotive Business
description:
Requisition ID: 23180
Job Category: Information Technology
Career level: Professional
Contract type: Permanent
Location:
Gothenburg, SE Puebla, MX Cajamar, BR  

  

*SKF has been around for more than a century and today we are one of the world’s largest global suppliers of bearings and supporting solutions for rotating equipment. Our products can be found literally everywhere in society. This means that we are an important part of the everyday lives of people and companies around the world.*  

  

*In September of 2024, SKF announced the separation of its Automotive business, with the objective to build two world-leading businesses. The role you are applying for will be part of the automotive business. This means you will have the opportunity to be a part of shaping a new company aimed at meeting the needs of the transforming global automotive market.*  

  

*Would you like to join us in shaping the future of motion? We are now looking for a …*

  


**Technical Lead - AI & Automation**  

**Automotive Business**

  


  

Do you thrive at the forefront of AI innovation and enterprise automation? At SKF Automotive’s Data Factory, we’re looking for a Technical Lead who combines visionary thinking with hands-on execution to shape the future of intelligent automation. In this role, you will architect and deliver AI-powered solutions using Power Platform, Copilot Studio, Azure AI Foundry and advanced ML technologies.  

  

You’ll build scalable agentic automation frameworks, lead strategic initiatives, and drive adoption across the organization. Working closely with stakeholders, you’ll define governance models, foster innovation, and ensure compliance with security and data standards. This is a key role in transforming how we work through AI-driven process integration and intelligent data workflows.

  


**What you can expect in the role**

* Own the AI and automation roadmap, driving integrated, intelligent workflows across the organization
* Design and architect scalable agentic AI systems that combine rule-based automation with generative AI to enable adaptive, autonomous decision-making
* Enable non-technical users through intuitive, natural‑language interactions with enterprise data using tools like Copilot Studio
* Build and lead an internal agentic AI community by providing training, reference architectures, and best‑practice solution designs
* Manage the commercial and operational performance of automation platforms, including cost optimization, ROI tracking, and monitoring
* Establish responsible AI governance, ethics, and compliance in close collaboration with security and risk teams
* Develop metadata-aware AI agents to improve data integration, traceability, and contextual understanding
* Mentor technical teams and collaborate with product owners, business stakeholders, and IT to align AI delivery with strategic goals
  


**You will enjoy working here if you have**



* A relevant academic background in computer science, software engineering, cloud computing, or a related technical field, combined with several years of experience in automation, AI/ML, or technical leadership roles
* Hands-on experience building and operating production-grade GenAI solutions using platforms such as Copilot Studio, Azure AI Foundry, Azure OpenAI, or similar technologies
* Strong knowledge of agentic AI architectures, including RAG, memory systems, multi-agent orchestration, and secure federation frameworks for scalable, interoperable agents
* A solid understanding of cloud architecture, data engineering workflows, enterprise systems, and modern data platforms (e.g., Snowflake, Databricks), with prior exposure to ML/AIOps practices
* Proven ability to lead technical teams and deliver high-impact solutions in complex, cross-functional environments

  


  

**Personal skills**



* Are a strategic thinker who turns complex AI concepts into scalable enterprise solutions
* Are passionate about transforming business processes through intelligent automation
* Enjoy leading cross-functional initiatives and mentoring technical teams
* Thrive in a dynamic environment driven by innovation, autonomy, and continuous learning
  


*SKF is committed to creating a diverse environment, and we firmly believe that a diverse workforce is essential for our continued success. Therefore, we only focus on your experience, skills, and potential. Come as you are – just be yourself. #weareSKF*  

  

**Some additional information**  

This position is located at any of SKF Automotive's main sites in Cajamar (Brazil), Puebla (Mexico), or Gothenburg (Sweden).  

Employment will be on a local contract, and therefore, you need to live in the region and be able to commute to our site several times per week.  

  

You will report to the Head of Data Factory. Please note that we can't accept applications and CVs via email or LinkedIn.  

  

**Is this you?**  

If this sounds like a good fit, please submit your application and CV in English by **March 6, 2026**. We review applications on an ongoing basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.  

  

*At SKF, we are committed to promoting fairness and inclusivity throughout our recruitment process. To achieve this, we may include assessments and verify the information in your application in compliance with country-specific laws and regulations.*

title: Data Platform Architect - Automotive Business
description:
Requisition ID: 22641
Job Category: Information Technology
Career level: Professional
Contract type: Permanent
Location:
Gothenburg, SE Puebla, MX Cajamar, BR  

  

*SKF has been around for more than a century and today we are one of the world’s largest global suppliers of bearings and supporting solutions for rotating equipment. Our products can be found literally everywhere in society. This means that we are an important part of the everyday lives of people and companies around the world.*

*In September of 2024, SKF announced the separation of its Automotive business, with the objective to build two world-leading businesses. The role you are applying for will be part of the automotive business. This means you will have the opportunity to be a part of shaping a new company aimed at meeting the needs of the transforming global automotive market.*  

  

*Would you like to join us in shaping the future of motion? We are now looking for a …*

  

**Data Platform Architect**

  

**Automotive Business**

  

Are you passionate about building modern, cloud-native data platforms from the ground up? At SKF Automotive’s, we’re looking for a Data Platform Architect who thrives in a hands-on environment and enjoys shaping the future of data infrastructure.  

  

**About the Role**  

In this pivotal role, you will be a principal architect and builder of the foundational technology & platform that underpins our entire Data operations. You will be responsible for creating the architectural blueprint and technology roadmap that will guide our evolution. By proactively partnering with Data Product Managers & Data Domain Leads, you ensure our data platform is not only powerful and scalable today but is also prepared for the challenges and opportunities of tomorrow.  

  

**What you can expect in the role**


* **Shape the Strategic Roadmap:** You’ll help define the architectural blueprint and lead the development of a clear, actionable roadmap for our cloud-native data platform.
* **Build Self Service Data Platform**: Lead the design and implementation of self-service data platform capabilities. This includes building automated provisioning, reusable ingestion and governance frameworks.
* **Implement Security Standards**: Collaborate with Cloud security engineers, Cybersecurity Architects and implement data quality, lineage, and compliance frameworks to ensure secure and trustworthy data use.
* **Implement Governance Policies**: Colloborate with Data Governace experts and implement data governance policies, lifecycle management, and cataloging practices
* **Lead and Collaborate**: Foster a strong engineering culture by sharing knowledge, mentoring others, and collaborating across teams to solve challenges and drive continuous improvement

  

  

**We expect you to have**


* Academic background in Computer Science, Information Systems, Cloud Computing, Software Engineering, or a related field is considered relevant.
* Several years of hands-on experience in data architecture, data platform engineering, or related fields, ideally within tech-driven or industrial environments.
* Proficient with tools such as, Snowflake, Databricks, Dbt, Azure, Terraform
* Advanced proficiency in Python and SQL.
* Strong expertise in data modeling, architecture patterns, and cloud-native data technologies.
* Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code (IaC), CI/CD pipelines, and containerization tools such as Docker and Kubernetes.
* Strong understanding of modern architectural paradigms like Data Mesh, Data Fabric, and Data as a Product, and the ability to apply them in practice.

  

  

**You will enjoy working here if you are**


* A dynamic environment where you work closely with cross-functional teams to drive meaningful data solutions.
* Opportunities to lead transformative initiatives and contribute to operational excellence.
* A culture that values proactive problem-solving, autonomy, and ongoing professional development.

  

  

*SKF is committed to creating a diverse environment, and we firmly believe that a diverse workforce is essential for our continued success. Therefore, we only focus on your experience, skills, and potential. Come as you are – just be yourself. #weareS*KF  

  

**Some additional information**  

This position is located at any of SKF Automotive's main sites in Cajamar (Brazil), Puebla (Mexico), or Gothenburg (Sweden).  

Employment will be on a local contract, and therefore, you need to live in the region and be able to commute to our site several times per week.  

  

You will report to the Head of Data Factory. Please note that we can't accept applications and CVs via email or LinkedIn.  

  

**Is this you?**  

If this sounds like a good fit, please submit your application and CV in English by **March 6, 2026**. We review applications on an ongoing basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.  

  

*At SKF, we are committed to promoting fairness and inclusivity throughout our recruitment process. To achieve this, we may include assessments and verify the information in your application in compliance with country-specific laws and regulations.*

title: Technology Department Manager – Hosting Infrastructure | SEB, Solna
description:
SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fuelled by collaboration. From Data Center to cloud and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity! **About the role:**  

You will lead a department with main responsibilities to develop and maintain the Hosting Infrastructure Deliveries consisting of Server Virtualization Platforms, Storage, Datacenter & Hardware Teams. The department consist of approximately 40+ people in 3-4 different team with 2 team managers reporting to you as the Department Manager, located in Stockholm.

As Department Manager for Hosting Platforms, you will play a critical role in ensuring operational excellence and building resilient infrastructure services that support our business-critical systems. You’ll lead a highly motivated and skilled management team, fostering a culture of strong delivery, accountability, innovation, and continuous improvement. While maintaining high standards in daily operations, you’ll also drive strategic change with balancing stability with technical transformation to meet evolving business needs.

You will report to the Area Head and play an active role in the Hosting Management team.
### **As a Technology Department Manager, you will:**

* Lead and guide and engage with your management team
* Drive operational excellence and own the overall department delivery roadmap and set strategy
* Secure stable and reliable infrastructure services
* Communicate and closely interact with leading representatives in various functions as well as with managers and architects within the Tech division.
* Ensure a healthy IT portfolio in your area from a risk, security, and compliance perspective
* Manage financial targets and frames for the department
* Be part of the Hosting Area Management Team
* Closely follow-up on compliancy, audit & IT security exercises and drive improvements together with your team members.

### **To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**

* Extensive leadership experience in the technology domain, with several years in managerial roles driving high-performing teams
* A proven track record as an IT leader with experience driving change in complex, business-critical, and demanding environments
* Technical proficiency within infrastructure domain
* A strong commitment to leadership, with the ability to build trust, attract talent, and develop people effectively
* Ability to balance existing operational models and strive for continuous development towards tomorrow’s ways of delivering services with Cloud, AI etc.
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to interact easily with all levels across the bank
* Fluency in English, which is required, with well-developed written communication skills.

### **What we offer:**

* Entrepreneurial Scandinavian environment
* Hybrid work model, meaning remote work is possible up to 2 days/week
* International opportunities and working environment
* Attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits

**Do you want to be part of SEB?**It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.  

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 2026-03-03. If you have questions about the position, please contact Robert Malmenbratt, Head of Hosting and Integration at: robert.malmenbratt@seb.se, but we will not be able to process applications via email.

Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks. **Learn more about working at SEB** on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
https://sebgroup.com/career
https://bit.ly/SEBcareer
company_description: More than 15.000 people work at SEB. Working in SEB means being part of an exciting journey, driven by digital transformation

title: Technical Services & Instrumentation Support Manager – Nordics
description:
Promega Biotech AB is seeking a highly qualified Technical Services & Instrumentation Support Manager to lead advanced scientific and technical support for our instrumentation and life science application portfolio across the Nordic region.
  
This senior professional role combines expert-level scientific consultancy, complex instrumentation troubleshooting, workflow automation and regional service coordination. The successful candidate will act as a recognised technical authority within the region, delivering structured, data-driven solutions across multidisciplinary environments spanning biology, engineering, automation systems and cloud-based digital workflows.
  
The position is based in Sweden and is open to applicants from Sweden, the EU/EEA and Switzerland.
  
Promega is an equal opportunity employer.
  
Scope of Responsibility
  
**Geographic coverage:** Nordic region (Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Finland, Iceland, Estonia)
  
Advanced Scientific Consultancy & Automation Expertise
  
Serve as regional subject-matter expert in molecular biology, cell biology, bioassays and automated nucleic acid purification workflows.
  
Provide advanced consultancy across both benchtop automated platforms and integrated liquid handling workflows within research and diagnostic laboratory environments.
  
Interpret complex biological and instrument-generated datasets to diagnose system-level performance issues and identify optimisation opportunities.
  
Lead protocol optimisation initiatives to improve assay robustness, automation reliability and workflow scalability.
  
Apply structured root-cause analysis across integrated biological, mechanical, electrical and software systems.
  
Analyse and resolve complex interactions between instrumentation hardware, automation software and biological assay chemistry.
  
Translate complex technical findings into clear, actionable recommendations for customers, sales teams and internal stakeholders.
  
Contribute scientific and systems-level insight to cross-functional teams including Sales, Engineering, Logistics and Global Technical Services.
  
  

Instrumentation & Technical Authority
  
Act as the regional technical authority for automated instrumentation platforms and associated reagent workflows.
  
Execute and coordinate installation, qualification, preventive maintenance, calibration and advanced troubleshooting activities.
  
Lead resolution of high-priority technical escalations requiring cross-functional collaboration and analytical decision-making.
  
Support optimisation of digital service processes and knowledge systems to enhance regional technical capability.
  
  

Digital Workflow & Systems Integration
  
Contribute to development and optimisation of cloud-based automation workflows supporting technical service and instrumentation processes.
  
Leverage data interrogation and business intelligence tools to analyse service performance, escalation trends and workflow efficiency.
  
Support integration of enterprise CRM and ERP systems to ensure accurate documentation, compliance and process visibility.
  
Apply structured analytical approaches to improve service scalability and technical decision-making.
  
  

Regional Service & Operational Coordination
  
Coordinate service planning, scheduling and technical resource alignment across the Nordic region.
  
Ensure documentation accuracy, regulatory compliance and quality standards within service and CRM systems.
  
Drive continuous improvement in service efficiency, knowledge sharing and technical capability development.
  
  

Commercial & Customer Engagement
  
Provide high-level technical consultation in support of instrumentation positioning, workflow design and integrated solution development.
  
Deliver advanced training, demonstrations and structured user support to customers and distribution partners.
  
Build long-term technical partnerships through credibility, expertise and consistent follow-up.
  
  

Required Qualifications
  
PhD in life sciences, molecular biology, cell biology or a closely related scientific discipline, or equivalent advanced research training.
  
Strong theoretical and practical expertise in molecular workflows, automated laboratory systems and experimental design.
  
Demonstrated experience in complex dataset analysis, scientific data interpretation and protocol optimisation within automated laboratory environments.
  
  

Technical & Operational Expertise
  
5+ Years of work in a commercial biotechnology company is advantageous.
  
Proven ability to resolve advanced integrated biological, mechanical, electrical and software challenges independently.
  
Demonstrated experience supporting benchtop and liquid handling automation systems.
  
Experience managing complex technical caseloads with structured prioritisation and escalation handling.
  
Strong analytical decision-making capability within high-responsibility environments.
  
Experience with enterprise CRM and ERP platforms such as Microsoft Dynamics 365, SAP and Microsoft 365 environments, or equivalent cloud-based systems.
  
Familiarity with cloud-based workflow automation tools and business intelligence platforms is advantageous.
  
Valid driver’s licence (B).
  
  

Professional Competencies
  
Exceptional communication skills with the ability to convey advanced technical concepts clearly.
  
High degree of autonomy, accountability and professional judgement.
  
Ability to operate effectively across geographically distributed markets.
  
  

Employment Conditions
  
Full-time permanent employment.
  
**Location:** Nacka, Sweden, with potential hybrid working options available.
  
Travel within the Nordic region and Estonia required.
  
Salary and employment conditions in line with Swedish collective agreements and industry standards.
  
Occupational pension (tjänstepension), occupational injury insurance (arbetsskadeförsäkring), group life insurance (tjänstegrupplivförsäkring) and health insurance apply from the first day of employment.
  
Overtime, when required, shall be compensated with time off in lieu in accordance with applicable Swedish law and industry standards.
  
Annual paid vacation of 33 days.
  
**Start date:** To be agreed with the successful candidate.
  
  

Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: Nattreceptionist sommaren 2026 till Scandic Värnamo!
description:
Nu söker vi inför sommaren en Nattreceptionist till Scandic Värnamo!
  
  

Vad är innebär rollen som Nattreceptionist?
  
Du som arbetar inom ansvarsområdet Front of House är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Ser till att gästens önskemål uppfylls. Du har alltid ett leende på läpparna och en kreativ lösning i backfikan. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. Din arbetsplats är vår lobby och frukostmatsal. För det är där du möter flest gäster. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete, städning av allmänna ytor och arbete med försäljning.
  
Arbetet i Front of House innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet. Allt arbete sker med gästnöjdhet och försäljning i fokus. När du jobbar natt i receptionen städa du även publika ytor och dukar fram och förbereda vår frukost.
  
Vem är du?
  
För att passa i rollen tror vi att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster.
  
Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.
  
Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning
  
Allra viktigast är dock dina personliga egenskaper och din inställning. För att passa i rollen behöver du vara en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.
  
Information om tjänsten
  
Tjänsten är en visstidsanställning i sommar. Därefter finns goda möjligheter att fortsätta jobba extra vid behov. Du bör vara över 20 år.
  
Intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdagen.

title: Business Development Representative - Nordics - V.I.E
description:
**OUR STORY:**  

\uD83C\uDDEA\uD83C\uDDFA Join Scaleway and shape the sovereign cloud of tomorrow !
Since 1999, we have been designing secure, sustainable infrastructures aimed at supporting the most ambitious companies.  

Historically known for our dedicated servers (Dedibox), we made a strategic shift to cloud computing in 2015. Staying true to our principles of simplicity, flexibility, and technical excellence, we have become one of the leading players in Europe in the sector.  

With the rise of artificial intelligence, we have strengthened our commitment, supported by the Iliad Group, which is investing €3 billion to develop a serious, sovereign AI alternative to American and Asian giants.  

Every day, thanks to our fast-growing portfolio of cloud and AI products (bare metal, containerization, serverless, AI, etc.), Scaleway proudly serves thousands of customer across the private and public sector, from corporations like France Télévisions or Hachette Livre, to fast-growing startups like Photoroom and Biolevate, to institutions like the City of Copenhagen.  

\uD83D\uDCCD Our offices are located in **Paris, Lille, Toulouse, Rennes, Rouen, Bordeaux and Lyon.** **WHY WE NEED YOU?**
Our growth in the Nordics region is driving us to strengthen our Sales team to accelerate strategic outbound prospection and expand our footprint across Sweden and neighboring markets.
Your mission will be to generate qualified opportunities through targeted outbound and inbound prospection in order to fuel pipeline growth and support our Account Executives in closing high-value cloud deals.  

  

**YOUR FUTURE TEAM**
We work in a collaborative and international environment where the diversity of
Scalers, combined with a spirit of sharing, helps bring new projects to life every day,
advancing our ambitions together.
You will be part of a team of 8 people composed of a Manager, a Team Lead, and
Business Development Representatives working closely with Account Executives.
Each BDR operates in a duo with an Account Executive, targeting around 200 strategic accounts.  

The team works collectively on cold calling sessions, outbound campaigns, account
mapping, and continuous training initiatives. With 80% of the team currently on
target, the culture is performance-driven, supportive, and highly collaborative.
Manager information: Orlando Bocaly**YOUR DAILY ROUTINE**
Tasks
Identify and prospect strategic target accounts in the Nordics region (mainly Sweden)
Execute cold calling, cold emailing, and outbound campaigns
Run structured prospection plans to reach and exceed monthly targets
Map accounts and identify key stakeholders and decision-makers
Qualify inbound leads and generate new outbound opportunities
Work closely in duo with Account Executives to build pipeline
Collaborate with Sales Architects to refine value propositions
Use tools such as Salesforce, Outreach, Lusha, Humanlinker, Gmail,
Scaleway internal tools, and Confluence
Participate in team prospecting sessions, events, and regional initiatives
Track performance metrics and continuously optimize outreach strategies **ABOUT YOU****HARDSKILLS :**
At least 1 year of experience as a Business Development Representative, Sales Development Representative, or Inside Sales Representative
Proven experience in outbound prospection (cold calling, cold email, hunting)
Knowledge of IT, SaaS, or Cloud environments (AI/cloud knowledge is a strong plus)
Experience using sales tools such as Salesforce, Outreach, or similar CRM/prospecting platforms
Ability to structure a prospection plan and manage a defined portfolio of target accounts **SOFTSKILLS :**
Strong hunting mindset with a results-driven approach
Excellent communication and social skills, charismatic and easy to talk to
Target-oriented with a clear understanding of KPIs and performance metrics
Resilient and comfortable with high-volume outbound activity
Fluent in Swedish, English and French **Why join the Scaleway adventure?**
✔ A rich and diverse product offering: Scaleway offers over 100 public cloud
products in IaaS, PaaS, and AI.
✔ A cutting-edge technical environment: Scaleway provides modern infrastructures,
including high-performance bare metal servers, to tackle exciting technical
challenges.
✔ Commitment to responsible cloud: Scaleway is dedicated to a more responsible
cloud, with data centers powered solely by renewable energy since 2017, minimizing
our ecological footprint and holding top-level certification.  

Additionally for this role :
Join a leading European cloud provider expanding in the Nordics
Attractive commission structure with strong earning potential
A high-performing team (80% on target)
Opportunities to attend industry events across the region
A strong, supportive, and performance-driven team culture **THE NEXT STEPS …**
HR screening with our Talent Acquisition team (30 min)
Interview with Orlando Bocaly, Hiring Manager, to understand your experience
and approach to prospection (45 min)
Role play and practical case (including video answers) to validate your
expertise (1h)
Interview with the Head of BDR and an Account Executive to deepen
discussions and assess team fit (45 min)
Final discussion with the CSO and office visit to meet your future colleagues
*At Scaleway, we are committed to building an inclusive and respectful workplace where everyone has a fair opportunity to thrive.**All applications are considered with care, regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, ethnic or social background, religion, disability, or any other characteristic.**We believe great ideas come from everywhere, and everyone which is why you should definitely apply.*
company_description: Scaleway is a Cloud Provider that supports the development, training, deployment, and scaling of infrastructure in a complete cloud ecosystem.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Machine Learning is a growing business area for us, and we work closely with our clients to understand what actually needs to be solved, then design and build solutions that hold up in production, not just in theory.


At Playground Data, we build modern data platforms for analytics, AI and machine learning. We are a collaborative team that values solid engineering and shared growth. Our engineers take ownership and work closely with clients to deliver high-quality solutions.

### **What you'll actually do**


You’ll work closely with our clients to understand business problems - and help resolving these by working hands on with data. Your responsibilities will stretch from the early experimentation stage to stable, production-grade systems.


The focus is true end-to-end ownership from problem framing and model design through deployment and ongoing reliability. Many of our engagements involve greenfield builds or major platform transformations.

**In practice, you’ll:**

* Design, build, and train machine learning models, translating real needs into working ML solutions.
* Own deployment and runtime performance in production, ensuring models are stable, monitored, and continuously improved once live.
* Establish and maintain MLOps workflows.
* Contribute internally by improving how we work with machine learning, shaping our ML practices and tooling, supporting presales when relevant, and helping Playground grow this expanding area.


You’ll never sit idle, there’s always something meaningful to build, improve, or untangle.

### **Who are you?**


You bring at least a few years of hands-on experience in Machine Learning Engineering, and you’ve moved beyond prototypes into systems that actually run in production. Python is your core language, MLOps is a natural part of how you think, and you care just as much about deployment and operation as you do about model performance.


You would probably describe yourself as someone who:

**Is technically-sound:** Except for strong Python skills, you have hands-on experience with ML frameworks (e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow, or scikit-learn). And are comfortable in the cloud (AWS, Azure, or GCP).

**Thinks beyond the model:** You know a good model is only half the job. You consider data quality, drift, monitoring, retraining, and how systems behave once they’re live.

**Keeps calm when things are unclear:** Business problems are rarely perfectly framed. You’re comfortable navigating uncertainty, iterating on hypotheses, and creating structure where there isn’t any yet.


As a person, you’re humble, genuinely curious about technology, and motivated, while knowing that asking for help is a strength, not a weakness. Friendly, curious, and playful.


You must be based in the Stockholm area and have a valid work permit for Sweden (no visa sponsorship or relocation).  

  

**Buzzword bingo:** AWS, Azure, GCP, Python, PyTorch, TensorFlow, scikit-learn, MLOps, Terraform, Docker

### **Language requirement**


Fluency in Swedish is a very-nice-to-have and English is a must. Why? Because most of our collaborations and client projects are conducted in Swedish.

### **Welcome to Playground!**


At Playground, you work on real, complex assignments for well-established and ambitious clients, not bench projects or short-lived experiments. Our teams are trusted with production systems, platforms, and data that actually matter. Here growth comes from ownership, curiosity, and doing the work properly. You’re trusted to think, contribute, and keep getting better, one meaningful step at a time.


Playground brings together specialized domains under one umbrella, with a shared culture and way of working, and easy access to broad technical expertise when it helps move the work forward.

title: Acquisition Sales Representative
description:
This role has been designed as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2 days per week from an HPE office.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.
   

  

**Job Description**
* Do You have the ability to position value?
* Do You have the skill to make complex things easy for others to adopt?
* Do people have trust in You?
* Do You love to sell?
* Do You have some experience from the IT Industry?


 Yes to above? Then You are probably our next rock star!
   

  

 We are strengthening our
 **Hunt/Acquisition team** 
 with a
 **Sales Representative** 
 . The mission for this team is to win new customers to HPE. The hunting space is approx. 100 enterprise accounts, in both private and public sector, where HPE see huge potential to grow. You will be part of a team that has been very successful during it´s two years of exist, and which is now levelling up even further.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Mapping, structuring and investigate the potential accounts
* Build stakeholder mapping that includes relevant roles
* Prepare and execute on a relevant storytelling that will lead to customer meetings with the right stakeholders
* Establish a professional, working, and consultative, relationship with the potential clients, by developing a core understanding of their unique business needs of the client within their industry.
* Lead the sales process from prospect to closure
* Understand, position and work with our relevant partners
* Quota Retirement
* Interface with both internal and external/industry experts to anticipate customer needs and facilitate solutions development.
* Manage the entire sales process in our CRM/Forecasting tool (Salesforce)


**Education And Experience Required**
* Typically 2-5 years of experience in IT sales
* Previous work experience with IT Infrastructure Sales (server, storage, network) will be considered a plus
* University or Bachelor's degree preferred, but not required.


**Knowledge And Skills**
* Hunting mentality
* Never give up attitude
* Self confident and determined to succeed
* Knowledge about product, service, solution and differentiators between own offerings and what competitor's offerings.
* Use knowledge in specialty, and consultative selling skills, to proactively help customers with making IT business decisions.
* Solid communication and presentation skills within IT at the manager level.
* Conceptualizes and articulates well-targeted solutions in area of specialty - product, service, solution -- from proposal to contract sign- off.
* Have enough knowledge about a product, service or solution to be able to qualify a deal.
* Maintain knowledge of industry trends, associated solutions, and key partner/ISV solutions.
* Regular use of Salesforce updating deal profile and forecasting accurately as per HPE sales process


**Additional Skills**
 Accountability, Accountability, Active Learning, Active Listening, Assertiveness, Bias, Building Rapport, Buyer Personas, Coaching, Complex Sales, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Cross-Functional Teamwork, Customer Experience Strategy, Customer Interactions, Design Thinking, Empathy, Financial Acumen, Follow-Through, Growth Mindset, Identifying Sales Opportunities, Industry Knowledge, Intellectual Curiosity (Inactive), Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity {+ 6 more}
   

  

**What We Can Offer You**
**Health & Wellbeing**
 We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.
   

  

**Personal & Professional Development**
 We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.
   

  

**Unconditional Inclusion**
 We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.
   

  

**Let's Stay Connected**
 Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.
   

  

 #sweden
   

  

 #sales
   

  

**Job**
 Sales
   

  

**Job Level**
 Intermediate
   

  

 HPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, or any other protected category, and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together. Please click here: Equal Employment Opportunity.
   

  

**Hewlett Packard Enterprise is EEO Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities.**
 HPE will comply with all applicable laws related to employer use of arrest and conviction records, including laws requiring employers to consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.
   

  

**No Fees Notice & Recruitment Fraud Disclaimer**
*It has come to HPE’s attention that there has been an increase in recruitment fraud whereby scammer impersonate HPE or HPE-authorized recruiting agencies and offer fake employment opportunities to candidates. These scammers often seek to obtain personal information or money from candidates.*
*Please note that Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), its direct and indirect subsidiaries and affiliated companies, and its authorized recruitment agencies/vendors
 **will never charge any candidate a registration fee, hiring fee, or any other fee in connection with its recruitment and hiring process.** 
 The credentials of any hiring agency that claims to be working with HPE for recruitment of talent should be verified by candidates and candidates shall be solely responsible to conduct such verification. Any candidate/individual who relies on the erroneous representations made by fraudulent employment agencies does so at their own risk, and HPE disclaims liability for any damages or claims that may result from any such communication.*

title: Senior Sales Development Representative
description:
⭐
 **Ready for your next challenge? Let’s talk.**
 At Bannerflow, we’re always interested in connecting with curious, driven people who want to grow with us. While our needs evolve over time, one thing stays constant: we value great talent and strong team players who want to make an impact.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 A strong team spirit built on trust & ownership
   

  

 We believe in giving people responsibility and the freedom to succeed. We trust each other, collaborate closely, and assume the best intentions. Together, we decide how to win.
   

  

**Continuous growth and new challenges**
 Our entrepreneurial mindset encourages initiative, experimentation, and learning. If you have ideas on how we can improve, scale, or work smarter — we want to hear them.
   

  

**A passionate and fun culture**
 We take our work seriously, but not ourselves. Expect a diverse and inclusive environment with activities like Health Month, inspirational talks, team events, company trips, board game nights, and more.
   

  

**A stable, global Ad Tech company with strong growth ambitions**
 Based in Stockholm and working with customers worldwide, Bannerflow continues to expand into new markets. With the support of our new owners, we’re well-positioned for continued growth in 2025 and beyond.
   

  

 🦋
 **You + Bannerflow?**
 From time to time, we look for talented Sales Development Representatives (SDRs) who want to grow within B2B SaaS and Ad Tech. In an SDR role at Bannerflow, you’d play a key part in building relationships with future customers, generating qualified leads, and supporting our commercial growth by working closely with Account Executives and the wider go-to-market team.
   

  

**What You Might Work On**
* Generating and nurturing qualified leads using modern tools and data-driven methods
* Engaging prospects and helping them understand the value of Bannerflow
* Managing and improving pipeline data in our CRM
* Staying curious about market trends and sharing insights with the team


**What We Typically Look For**
* 1.5+ years of experience in sales development or a similar commercial role
* A strong sense of ownership and motivation to grow
* Comfort using prospecting tools like LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Salesloft, or Cognism
* Strong communication skills in English (additional languages are always a plus)
* A commercial mindset and interest in SaaS, Ad Tech, and B2B sales


**Why Bannerflow?**
 We’re a values-driven company built on passion, collaboration, and challenge. Here, you’ll have the chance to grow alongside experienced colleagues, influence how we work, and be part of a team shaping the future of creative automation in Ad Tech.
   

  

 We offer a hybrid work setup, competitive compensation, ITP1 pension, health allowance, parental leave top-up, and health insurance, plus a culture filled with padel tournaments, hackathons, webinars, and Friday beers 🍻

title: IT Consultant - Stockholm | BCG Platinion
description:

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. title: Solutions Architect
description:
**Lösningsarkitekter till B3 Visab Consulting**
 Hos B3 Visab Consulting stödjer vi finansindustrins utveckling i den digitala ekonomin. Vi söker nu fler engagerade lösningsarkitekter som vill vara med och bidra till en samhällskritisk bransch. Med över 40 års erfarenhet har vi byggt långsiktiga relationer med ledande aktörer inom bank och försäkring, och vår expertis gör oss även till en attraktiv partner för snabbfotade uppstickare.
   

  

**Om rollen:** 
 Som lösningsarkitekt hos oss får du möjligheten att arbeta som konsult i varierande uppdrag där du hjälper kunder att utveckla och implementera robust lösningsarkitektur. Du kommer till exempel att:
   

  

* Bryta ned krav och behov och omvandla dessa till förstklassiga lösningar.
* Designa och dokumentera olika arkitekturlösningar.
* Vägleda utvecklingsteamet och säkerställa att lösningen överensstämmer med den övergripande arkitekturen.
* Agera bollplank, ge råd och stöd till både verksamhet och utvecklare.


**Vidare ser vi att du har följande kvalifikationer:**
* Minst 4 års erfarenhet från lösningsarkitektrollen.
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet från bank- eller försäkringsområdet.
* Kompetens och erfarenhet av integrationslösningar mellan applikationer/system.
* Färdigheter inom dokumentation.
* Erfarenhet från konsultrollen.
* Certifieringar och erfarenheter inom relevanta områden.
* Arbetar obehindrat på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


 Vi tror att framgång bygger på samarbete och kunskapsdelning och vi ser gärna att du är en lagspelare som uppskattar att arbeta prestigelöst och flexibelt.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder:**
* Attraktiv och flexibel lönemodell.
* Möjlighet att påverka dina arbetstider och arbetsplats.
* Tillgång till utbildningar och certifieringar för din professionella utveckling.
* En stark wellness-satsning genom Team B3, som främjar både hälsa och arbetsglädje.


**Varför B3 Visab Consulting?** 
 Vi är en del av B3 Consulting Group, ett av Sveriges snabbast växande företag inom IT och management. Hos oss får du det bästa av två världar: kraften från ett stort bolag och den personliga samhörigheten från ett mindre. Vi är stolta över att ha blivit erkända som "Årets Karriärföretag" och av "Great Place to Work". Våra medarbetare pratar om friheten att påverka sina uppdrag, arbetsmiljön där olikheter välkomnas, och stoltheten över att bidra till både kunders framgång och samhället i stort. Vi samarbetar med initiativ som Women in Tech, Changers Hub och Pink Programming för att göra skillnad.
   

  

**Kontakt** 
 Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär? Ansök nu! Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Lidia Hagos (lidia.hagos@b3.se) eller konsultchef Hanna Skoog (+4670-260 12 65).

title: Cloud Backend Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Strong expertise in Java/J2EE, Spring Framework, Hibernate
* Proven experience building RESTful APIs and web services
* Hands-on experience with GCP (Cloud Run, BigQuery, Bigtable, Apache Pulsar)
* Solid foundation in object-oriented design, system architecture, and scalability
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines and automated testing frameworks


**Application deadline:** 
 24-02-2026
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Platform Engineer - Infrastructure
description:
**TL;DR** 
 We’re looking for an exceptional platform engineer to design and scale the infrastructure behind the future of AI software engineering. You will build and operate the lower part of our stack, making sure that it meets the massive scaling demands of Lovable.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* Deep experience building production infrastructure as a Platform Engineer, Site Reliability Engineer or similar.
* You have deep experience with service orchestration, networking, cloud infrastructure and general modern scalable infrastructure practices from a global tech startup or scale-up.
* You have strong programming skills.
* You’re comfortable navigating ambiguity and solving problems as they arise.
* You care about security, stability, and speed and know when to make trade-offs between them.
* You’re based in Stockholm or ready to relocate - this is an on-site, 5-days-a-week role.


**What You’ll Do**
**In one sentence:** 
 Own and scale the platform that makes AI engineering work for everyone.
   

  

* Design, build and maintain the systems that enable our AI product, such as:
+ A runtime environment for running AI agent workloads in a secure and scalable way.
+ High throughput Sandbox scheduler across multiple cloud providers.

* Harden our infrastructure against failures, downtime, and slowdowns.
* Support our growth, make sure that our infrastructure never becomes a bottleneck.
* Plan and implement our network infrastructure and cloud strategy.
* Identify and drive reliability improvement efforts across all engineering teams.


**Our tech stack**
 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love. Lovable platform engineers are capable of working across the whole stack. Examples of tech in our stack include:
   

  

* Frontend: React and Typescript.
* Backend: Golang and Rust.
* Cloud: Cloudflare, GCP, AWS, Modal.
* Data: Clickhouse, Firestore, Spanner, BigQuery.
* DevOps & Tooling: CI/CD pipelines, OTEL, kubernetes, terraform.


 And always on the lookout for what's next!
   

  

**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English - it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal
