title: Lösningsarkitekt
description:
**Att jobba som lösningsarkitekt nätverk**
 I rollen som lösningsarkitekt nätverk kliver du in som en central del av vår arkitekturförmåga, med det operativa och strategiska ansvaret för att forma samt styra utvecklingen av vår datakommunikationsplattform inom Skandias IT- infrastruktur. Ditt uppdrag är att ta helhetsansvar för lösningarna inom nätverk och säkerställa att de är i linje med vår IT-strategi och målarkitektur. Du leder analyser i tidiga faser, definierar riktning, hanterar beroenden och bryter ner behov i epics och features.
   

  

 Rollen innebär att du även arbetar med design, utveckling och styrning av nätverkslösningar som stödjer både verksamhetens behov och framtida teknikutveckling.
   

  

 I rollen ingår ansvar för flera teknikområden:
   

  

* Nätverk (LAN, WAN, WLAN, SD-WAN)
* Säkerhet (brandväggar, segmentering, Zero Trust)
* Moln & fjärråtkomst (Azure, MSP, VPN)
* Trafikstyrning (lastbalansering, proxy)
* Adresshantering (DNS, DHCP, IPAM)
* Automation (SDN och relaterade teknologier)


 Teamet du kommer tillhöra består av ett tiotal specialister som arbetar med Skandias applikations- och infrastrukturstöd. Gruppen ansvarar för utveckling, förvaltning och 3:e nivåsupport av infrastrukturnära plattformar. Vi sitter tillsammans i våra lokaler i Stockholm. Vår arbetskultur kännetecknas av kunskapsutbyte och ett teknikintresse där teamsamarbete står i fokus.
   

  

 Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till IT-gruppchef applikation- och infrastruktur.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Vi söker dig som har några års erfarenhet av att arbeta som lösningsarkitekt, gärna inom nätverk eller infrastruktur. Du har en solid teknisk grund att stå på och trivs i gränslandet mellan teknik och verksamhet. Du har djup förståelse för nätverksarkitektur och säkerhetslösningar där du driver lösningar från idé till implementering. Ett grundkrav i rollen är att du behärskar svenska flytande både i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Som person är du strukturerad, prestigelös och trygg i din kommunikation. Du har lätt för att samarbeta med andra specialister och ta diskussioner kopplat till det strategiska arbetet.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Alexander Larre på alexander.larre@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocess, vänligen ta kontakt med Talent Acquisition Partner Harald Brehmer på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Mobility Specialist
description:
JD
 



  





 Primary Focus: Migration from SOTI MobiControl to SOTI MobiCloud, rugged Android ecosystems, and Cloud Link Agent integrations
 



  





 ROLE SUMMARY
 



 We are seeking an experienced SOTI Domain Subject Matter Expert (SME) at L3 capability level to lead and support enterprise mobility environments across global operations. The primary responsibility is to architect, plan, and execute the migration of a large‑scale device fleet from SOTI MobiControl (on‑prem) to SOTI MobiCloud (SaaS) while providing advanced troubleshooting, optimization, and lifecycle management.
 



  





 The ideal candidate brings deep expertise in Android Enterprise, rugged mobility platforms (Honeywell & Zebra), enterprise integrations via Cloud Link Agent, and large‑scale industrial environments.
 



  





 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
 



 Migration & Architecture
 



 - Lead the end‑to‑end migration from SOTI MobiControl on‑prem to SOTI MobiCloud.
 



 - Design Android Enterprise fully managed, work profile, and dedicated device deployments.
 



 - Align SOTI configuration, profiles, compliance rules, and architecture with cloud best practices.
 



 - Collaborate with security, networking, and infrastructure teams.
 



  





 L3 Support & Operations
 



 - Serve as top‑tier escalation for MobiControl/MobiCloud issues.
 



 - Troubleshoot agent behavior, deployment failures, device check‑in issues, and OEM‑specific challenges.
 



 - Optimize performance and automation using scripts and SOTI APIs.
 



  





 Automation & Scripting
 



 - Develop advanced SOTI scripts, automation flows, and REST‑API integrations.
 



 - Implement workflow efficiencies across device lifecycle.
 



  





 RUGGED DEVICE & PLATFORM EXPERTISE
 



 Honeywell Devices
 



 - Honeywell Mobility Edge platforms (CT, Thor, Dolphin).
 



 - Honeywell Enterprise Launcher, DCP, SDK integrations.
 



 - Deep knowledge of scanning, peripherals, key remapping, and device APIs.
 



  





 Zebra Devices
 



 - Expertise with TC, MC, WT, ET series.
 



 - Zebra StageNow, MX Extensions, OEMConfig, DataWedge.
 



 - Troubleshooting printing, scanning, networking, and EMM integrations.
 



  





 Android Enterprise Specialization
 



 - Android Enterprise provisioning, zero‑touch, managed Google Play.
 



 - OEMConfig policies, compliance frameworks, and platform hardening.
 



 - Knowledge of AOSP variants and industrial integrations.
 



  





 CLOUD LINK AGENT & ENTERPRISE INTEGRATION EXPERTISE
 



 Cloud Link Agent (CLA)
 



 - Architect, deploy, and manage Cloud Link Agent for secure hybrid connectivity.
 



 - Configure HA setups, certificates, routing, and secure tunnels.
 



 - Troubleshoot CLA service dependencies and connector failures.
 



  





 Identity & Directory Integrations
 



 Active Directory (AD)
 



 - LDAP/LDAPS integrations, authentication, user/device mapping.
 



  





 Entra ID (Azure AD)
 



 - OAuth/OIDC integrations.
 



 - Conditional Access for Android Enterprise.
 



 - Certificates, token management, API permissions.
 



  





 Google Services & Android Integrations
 



 - Managed Google Play, zero‑touch, private app publishing.
 



 - Integrations with Google EMM services, Play Integrity, and device attestation.
 



  





 Enterprise App Integrations
 



 - Integrating internal and third‑party systems using REST APIs.
 



 - Automating LOB app deployments, provisioning, and lifecycle flows.
 



  





 GENERAL SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
 



 - 5–10+ years in Enterprise Mobility Management.
 



 - 4+ years with SOTI MobiControl/MobiCloud.
 



 - Experience with rugged mobility in logistics, retail, manufacturing.
 



 - Strong knowledge of industrial Wi‑Fi tuning (802.11 k/r/v).
 



 - Excellent communication and stakeholder management.
 



  





 PREFERRED CERTIFICATIONS
 



 - SOTI MobiControl Certification.
 



 - Honeywell or Zebra certifications.
 



 - Android Enterprise Professional/Expert.
 



 - ITIL Foundation.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Machine Learning is a growing business area for us, and we work closely with our clients to understand what actually needs to be solved, then design and build solutions that hold up in production, not just in theory.
 



 At Playground Data, we build modern data platforms for analytics, AI and machine learning. We are a collaborative team that values solid engineering and shared growth. Our engineers take ownership and work closely with clients to deliver high-quality solutions.
 


 What you'll actually do
 
 You’ll work closely with our clients to understand business problems - and help resolving these by working hands on with data. Your responsibilities will stretch from the early experimentation stage to stable, production-grade systems.
 



 The focus is true end-to-end ownership from problem framing and model design through deployment and ongoing reliability.
 
 Many of our engagements involve greenfield builds or major platform transformations.
 




**In practice, you’ll:** 



* Design, build, and train machine learning models, translating real needs into working ML solutions.
* Own deployment and runtime performance in production, ensuring models are stable, monitored, and continuously improved once live.
* Establish and maintain MLOps workflows.
* Contribute internally by improving how we work with machine learning, shaping our ML practices and tooling, supporting presales when relevant, and helping Playground grow this expanding area.




 You’ll never sit idle, there’s always something meaningful to build, improve, or untangle.
 



 Who are you?
 
 You bring at least a few years of hands-on experience in Machine Learning Engineering, and you’ve moved beyond prototypes into systems that actually run in production. Python is your core language, MLOps is a natural part of how you think, and you care just as much about deployment and operation as you do about model performance.
 



 You would probably describe yourself as someone who:
 



**Is technically-sound:** 
 Except for strong Python skills, you have hands-on experience with ML frameworks (e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow, or scikit-learn). And are comfortable in the cloud (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
 



**Thinks beyond the model:** 
 You know a good model is only half the job. You consider data quality, drift, monitoring, retraining, and how systems behave once they’re live.
 



**Keeps calm when things are unclear:** 
 Business problems are rarely perfectly framed. You’re comfortable navigating uncertainty, iterating on hypotheses, and creating structure where there isn’t any yet.
 



 As a person, you’re humble, genuinely curious about technology, and motivated, while knowing that asking for help is a strength, not a weakness. Friendly, curious, and playful.
 



 You must be based in the Stockholm area and have a valid work permit for Sweden (no visa sponsorship or relocation).
   

  

**Buzzword bingo:** 
 AWS, Azure, GCP, Python, PyTorch, TensorFlow, scikit-learn, MLOps, Terraform, Docker
 


 Language requirement
 
 Fluency in Swedish is a very-nice-to-have and English is a must. Why? Because most of our collaborations and client projects are conducted in Swedish.
 


 Welcome to Playground!
 
 At Playground, you work on real, complex assignments for well-established and ambitious clients, not bench projects or short-lived experiments. Our teams are trusted with production systems, platforms, and data that actually matter. Here growth comes from ownership, curiosity, and doing the work properly. You’re trusted to think, contribute, and keep getting better, one meaningful step at a time.
 



 Playground brings together specialized domains under one umbrella, with a shared culture and way of working, and easy access to broad technical expertise when it helps move the work forward.

title: Service Manager IT Security Operations (SecOps)
description:
emagine is seeking a Service Manager for a client within the construction industry to strengthen for its IT Security Operations (SecOps) function. The role is responsible for managing day-to-day security operations, coordinating with Service Managers across Digital Workplace, Cloud, and On-Premises environments, and ensuring the consistent and effective delivery of security services.
   

  

**Start: 2026-03-02**
**End: 2026-09-30**
**Location: Stockholm, 2-3 days/ week at the office.**
**About the assignment:**
 The assignment aims to improve operational efficiency, establish structured vulnerability management practices, and drive initiatives that enhance the organization’s overall security posture. The Service Manager will collaborate closely with internal teams and external suppliers to align processes, manage security incidents, support compliance requirements (particularly ISO 27001), and lead continuous improvement efforts.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Coordinate daily SecOps activities and ensure smooth service delivery.
* Establish and maintain structured processes for vulnerability management.
* Strengthen collaboration across Digital Workplace, Cloud, and On-Premises service areas.
* Initiate and drive improvements to the organization’s overall security posture.
* Integrate DevOps practices into security operations where relevant.
* Provide regular reporting and status updates to stakeholders on security operations, improvements, and compliance activities.


**Required Competence And Experience**
* Leading or managing security operations in medium to large organizations.
* Vulnerability management, incident management, and log management.
* Microsoft security technologies and detection services.
* Coordinating cross-functional teams across infrastructure, cloud, and workplace environments.
* Driving initiatives that improve security maturity and operational effectiveness.
* Supporting and implementing compliance frameworks within IT SecOps, particularly ISO 27001.


**Required Skills (Must Have)**
* Strong expertise in the Microsoft security ecosystem (e.g., Defender suite, Sentinel, Entra ID).
* Experience with detection and monitoring platforms (SIEM / SOAR).
* Hands-on experience with vulnerability management tools and processes.
* Understanding of DevOps principles and their application within SecOps.
* Familiarity with ISO 27001 controls and compliance activities.
* Excellent communication in Swedish and English, coordination, and stakeholder management skills.
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and incident management capabilities.


**Preferred Qualifications (Nice To Have)**
* Experience in cloud security, particularly Azure and/or multi-cloud environments.
* Knowledge of additional regulatory or compliance frameworks (e.g., NIST, GDPR).
* Experience with ITIL or formal service management frameworks.
* Understanding of OWASP, secure development practices, or application security.
* Experience working in multinational or distributed organizational environments.

title: First Infrastructure Lead – Build Europe’s Secure AI Platform
description:
**About Intric**
 Intric is accelerating its growth, backed by new funding and strong demand from both existing and new customers.
   

  

 Our platform, Intric.ai, is transforming how work gets done, particularly within the public sector and organizations that prioritize data sovereignty. We make advanced AI accessible, secure, and practical, and we have secured a market-leading position within our niche.
   

  

 We are now looking for an
 **Infrastructure Lead** 
 to own and define how our platform scales.
   

  

**The Role**
 This is not a maintenance role.
   

  

 You will:
   

  

* Own Intric’s entire infrastructure architecture
* Design secure, scalable systems for AI workloads
* Build the foundation for European expansion
* Define how we run AI in highly regulated environments
* Make key architectural decisions that shape the company


 You will be the first dedicated infrastructure hire, working closely with our founder and engineering team.
   

  

 Your decisions will directly impact:
   

  

* Platform reliability
* Security posture
* Developer velocity
* Our ability to serve governments across Europe


**What You’ll Build**
 Our platform enables organisations to deploy AI agents in secure environments. That means:
   

  

* Running AI/LLM workloads in production
* Designing highly available Kubernetes-based systems
* Managing cloud infrastructure with strict security constraints
* Building for data sovereignty and regulatory compliance
* Scaling from tens to hundreds of enterprise customers


 You will work with technologies such as:
   

  

* Kubernetes
* Docker
* Redis
* pgvector
* vLLM
* Cloud infrastructure (AWS/GCP/Azure)
* Linux environments


 Experience with GPU workloads or AI infrastructure is a strong plus.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You likely:
   

  

* Have 4–8+ years building and running production infrastructure
* Have designed highly available systems before
* Are comfortable owning architecture decisions
* Have worked in startups or fast-moving environments
* Care deeply about security and robustness
* Prefer building over maintaining
* Want real ownership, not just tickets


 A formal degree is less important than your ability to build and execute.
   

  

 You must have EU work authorization.
   

  

**Why This Role Is Different**
 This is a career-defining opportunity.
   

  

 You won’t be one of many infrastructure engineers.
   

  

 You will:
   

  

* Define how sovereign AI infrastructure is built in Europe
* Shape the technical standards for AI in regulated industries
* Work directly with leadership and investors
* Help scale from 60+ organisations to hundreds


 Given the geopolitical landscape and increasing demand for European AI sovereignty, this space is only accelerating.
   

  

**Compensation & Practicalities**
* Competitive salary and meaningful stock options
* Meaningful stock options
* 25 days paid vacation
* Wellness allowance
* Office in Stockholm (flexible setup)


**Culture at Intric**
 At Intric, we build secure AI solutions for organizations that cannot afford to get it wrong. We operate in environments where quality, responsibility, and long-term trust are essential.
   

  

 We value ownership and high standards. You are expected to take initiative, think critically, and contribute beyond your immediate scope when needed. Collaboration is key, but so is independent execution.
   

  

 We move fast, but we prioritize doing things properly. As we expand across Europe, every team member plays a role in shaping both the product and the culture.

title: Application Security Engineer
description:
**TL;DR** 
 We are seeking an Application Security Engineer to champion security across our entire development lifecycle. You’ll play a pivotal role in reviewing code, designing secure features, and mentoring engineers, ensuring security is at the heart of everything we build. If you’re passionate about application security, thrive on close collaboration with developers, and want to do the work of your life, this is your opportunity
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable enables anyone to build software using plain English. From solo founders to Fortune 100 teams, millions use Lovable to turn ideas into products—quickly and securely. We’re leading a fundamental shift in how software is created, and you’ll help shape the security standards for this new era. With over 2 million users in 200+ countries, our reach is global—and growing fast.
   

  

 We’re a small, high-impact team based in Stockholm, driven by ownership, speed, and low-ego collaboration. We value people who care deeply, move quickly, and want to make a real difference.
   

  

**What You’ll Bring**
* 5+ years of experience in application security, securing cloud-native environments at product-focused tech companies, high-growth startups, or leading AI labs.
* Strong programming and engineering skills.
* Deep expertise in application security: secure code review, threat modeling, SAST/DAST, supply chain security, product patching, and vulnerability management.
* Strong background in securing engineering infrastructure: CI/CD pipelines, secrets management, service-to-service authentication, containerized workloads, and public cloud platforms.
* Hands-on experience collaborating with developers to design and implement security features and best practices.
* Passion for educating and mentoring engineers on secure coding, vulnerability remediation, and emerging threats.
* Systems mindset: comfortable reading and contributing to codebases, building security tooling, and integrating security into engineering workflows.
* Bonus: Experience building internal security tools or contributing to open-source security projects.


**What You’ll Do**
* Conduct secure code reviews, threat modeling, and architecture assessments to identify and mitigate vulnerabilities early.
* Work closely with engineering teams to design and implement security features, provide actionable feedback, and ensure security is embedded in product development.
* Lead security training, workshops, and 1:1 mentoring to upskill developers and foster a security-first culture.
* Integrate SAST/DAST and supply chain security tools into our CI/CD pipelines for continuous, automated protection.
* Detect, triage, and respond to application vulnerabilities and incidents, driving remediation and continuous improvement.
* Monitor and address emerging risks in AI infrastructure, LLM pipelines, and third-party dependencies.
* Secure the last piece of software.


**Our Tech Stack**
* Frontend: React and Typescript
* Backend: Golang and Rust
* Cloud: Cloudflare, Google Cloud, AWS, Modal, Terraform
* DevOps & Tooling: CI/CD pipelines, observability, infrastructure-as-code


 And always exploring what’s next.
   

  

**How To Apply**
* Please submit your application in English—our working language at Lovable.
* We’re committed to fair and equal treatment for all candidates. If you’re interested, apply via our careers portal

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Därför är detta jobb för dig**
 För att du älskar att skapa system som är effektiva, kostnadseffektiva och använder en modern teknikstack, och du ser dig själv som en väsentlig del av teamet där din och teamets vision blir verklighet i molnet. Du vill göra skillnad genom att bidra med perspektiv, färdigheter och erfarenhet till olika branscher och miljöer.
   

  

**Bygg en karriär du kan vara stolt över**
 Som en del av vårt team kan din resa ta olika vägar när du utvecklar system tillsammans med våra kunder. Arbetet sker in-house i team från våra egna lokaler – alltid med målet att leverera resultat av hög kvalitet. Du kan till exempel skapa en IoT-plattform, utveckla en applikation för sensorhantering inom MedTech, eller bygga en dataplattform för industriell produktion. Exakt vilket projekt du kommer att arbeta med vet vi först när du har blivit en del av Knightec Group, och det är just den variationen och möjligheten att själv välja projekt som gör arbetet här så spännande!
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta inom affärsområdet Software & Cloud som hjälper kunder att utveckla framtidssäkra, storskaliga dator- och mjukvarusystem över hela IT-landskapet – från elektroniska enheter och nätverk till datadrivna företagsapplikationer med stöd av AI och molntjänster.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Designa och bygga skalbara data pipelines och ETL/ELT-flöden i molnmiljö.
* Utveckla datalösningar med fokus på kodkvalitet och mjukvaruutvecklingsprinciper.
* Arbeta med datamodellering och dataplattformar som Databricks och Snowflake.
* Integrera och automatisera dataflöden mellan system och API:er.
* Delta i hela utvecklingscykeln, från implementation till produktionssatt lösning.


**Kvalifikationer**
* Erfarenhet av backend- eller fullstackutveckling av moderna system och API:er.
* Erfarenhet av att bygga eller arbeta med moderna dataplattformar och data pipelines.
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar (AWS eller Azure).
* Erfarenhet av moderna data- eller infrastrukturverktyg som Databricks, Snowflake eller Terraform är meriterande.
* Universitetsexamen inom datateknik eller liknande.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


**En spännande resa med Knightec Group**
 Semcon och Knightec har gått samman som Knightec Group. Tillsammans bildar vi Norra Europas ledande strategiska partner inom produkt- och digital tjänsteutveckling – hur häftigt är inte det?
   

  

 Med en unik kombination av tvärfunktionell expertis och en holistisk förståelse för affärer hjälper vi våra kunder att förverkliga sina strategier – från idé till färdig lösning. På Knightec Group finns kompetensen, attityden och drivkraften som krävs för att anta de mest utmanande och innovativa projekten.
   

  

 För våra medarbetare innebär detta fantastiska möjligheter att vara med och forma framtiden genom meningsfulla projekt i teknikens absoluta framkant. Här får du inte bara utvecklas och växa, utan också bli en del av något större.
   

  

**Praktisk information**
 Tjänsten är placerad på vårt kontor i Stockholm, Rättarvägen 3 (Solna United). Startdatum är så snart som möjligt eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, men senast 2026-05-01. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Albert Lindfors, Talent Acquisition Partner. Observera att vi, på grund av GDPR, endast tar emot ansökningar via vår karriärsida.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Senior Systemförvaltare EBO
description:
***Vill du ha en nyckelroll i förvaltningen av ett affärskritiskt, globalt installerat EBO-system? Vi söker nu en mycket senior systemförvaltare med djup teknisk kompetens och stark förmåga att leda och samordna arbete i komplexa, internationella IT-miljöer.***




  





**Om rollen** 




 I rollen som
 **Senior Systemförvaltare EBO** 
 ansvarar du för den tekniska och applikatoriska förvaltningen av vår beställares EBO-system, som är installerat och används globalt. Rollen omfattar såväl strategiskt som operativt ansvar och kräver ett helhetsperspektiv på systemförvaltning i enterprise-miljö.
 



 En central del av uppdraget är att
 **leda och utveckla samarbetet med vår organisation i Makedonien** 
 , som utgör en integrerad del av leveransen inom systemförvaltning och support.
 



 Du fungerar som huvudkontakt, säkerställer tydliga arbetssätt, kvalitetsnivåer och ett effektivt samspel mellan lokala och globala funktioner.
 



  





**Om dig** 




 Vi söker dig som är trygg, självgående och strategisk, med ett starkt ägarskap för dina ansvarsområden. Du har förmåga att driva och leda samarbeten även utan formellt personalansvar och skapar engagemang genom förtroende och tydlighet.
 



 Du arbetar analytiskt och lösningsorienterat, med ett tydligt fokus på kvalitet och leverans. Med din mycket goda kommunikationsförmåga är du van att samverka i internationella sammanhang och kan anpassa ditt budskap till olika målgrupper och kulturer.
 



  





**Ansvarsområden** 



* Systemförvaltning och vidareutveckling av EBO-plattformen i global drift
* Applikatorisk förvaltning, inklusive konfiguration, versionshantering och uppgraderingar
* Ledning och koordinering av samarbetet med organisationen i Makedonien inom systemförvaltning och support
* Säkerställande av IT-säkerhet, accesshantering och efterlevnad av interna och externa krav
* Drift och förvaltning i Windows-miljö
* Databashantering, felsökning och prestandaoptimering i SQL
* Samarbete med globala intressenter, leverantörer och lokala IT-team
* Incident-, problem- och förändringshantering enligt etablerade processer
* Dokumentation och vidareutveckling av förvaltningsmodeller, SLA:er och arbetssätt



  





**Kvalifikationer (krav)** 



* Mycket hög senioritet inom systemförvaltning av EBO (flerårig dokumenterad erfarenhet)
* Djup teknisk kompetens inom:
* EBO-plattformen
* Windows Server-miljöer
* SQL (administration, felsökning, prestanda)
* IT-säkerhet i komplexa systemlandskap
* Erfarenhet av globalt installerade system och arbete i internationella organisationer
* Erfarenhet av att leda eller koordinera leverans- och supportfunktioner, gärna i offshore- eller nearshore-upplägg
* Flytande engelska i tal och skrift (obligatoriskt)



  





**Meriterande** 



* Erfarenhet av regulatoriska eller säkerhetskritiska miljöer
* Kunskap om integrationslösningar och systemkopplingar
* Erfarenhet av ITIL, SIAM eller liknande ramverk



  





**Vi erbjuder** 




 Init Sweden är en av Nordens ledare inom industriell IT och automation. Idag består Init av ca 15 nordiska företag med en total omsättning på 1,5 Miljard SEK och 950 anställda i Danmark, Sverige, Norge och Spanien, som är specialister inom industriell IT, automation, IOT och OT cybersäkerhet. Init har en tydlig ambition om att vara den bästa partnern för kunder som fokuserar på optimering, digitalisering, säkerhet och grön omställning av sina anläggningar.
 


* En nyckelroll med reellt inflytande över global systemförvaltning och supportleverans
* Möjlighet att arbeta både strategiskt och tekniskt nära verksamheten
* En professionell organisation med hög teknisk och processmässig mognad
* Ett företag med en tydlig och kontrollerad tillväxtstrategi
* Goda karriärmöjligheter med professionella, inspirerande och innovativa miljöer med plats för nörderi och professionell utveckling.
* Ett företag som stöttar ditt specialområde i ett samhälle med hög ambitionsnivå.



  





**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm, Malmö, Göteborg, Karlskrona (valfri ort)
 



**Närmaste ledare:** 
 Viktor Wangrosso, Division Manager
 



  





 Vi läser ansökningar och träffar kandidater löpande så skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Vid frågor, kontakta mig, Rekryterare Sara Rensfeldt Romin, på sara.rensfeldt@initgroup.com
 



 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! #Init2winit
 



  





*Init hjälper verksamheter att göra styrning, övervakning och systemintegration smartare. Vi kombinerar affär, organisation och teknik så att allt hänger ihop – i praktiken.* 




*Vi är vana vid miljöer med höga krav på effektivitet, tillgänglighet och säkerhet. Därför tar vi ansvar hela vägen: från idé och design till programmering, driftsättning och löpande underhåll. Då kan kunden fokusera på sin kärnverksamhet.* 




*Vi har gjort det här i mer än 30 år, i fastigheter, industri och infrastruktur – alltid med samma mål: att göra komplexa system enklare att använda.*

title: Senior AI - Developer
description:
**Providing Value & Impact - SwedQ.**
 SwedQ is a consultancy company that has lately proven to have a unique model for those who want to grow, create a legacy, and take on challenges that both add and gain value. Year after year, we have managed to serve clients within a wide range of industries (intentionally excluding gambling and weaponry). During this time, we have also grown steadily—in revenue, in team size, and in the impact of our deliveries.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who wants to be part of the company in a literal sense. That means taking on the technical challenges as well as getting a portion of the company in the future. If you would like, you can also drive your own ideas forward and implement them with us. You’ll be working closely with everyone here, which makes it easy to bring change and act on what you believe in.
   

  

**What's in it for you?**
 Some people value fixed salaries, pensions, and stability. Others want a bigger share of the pie and are ready to share the risks. Let’s talk that through. One thing is certain—we’ll make sure you find your “it,” whether that’s with us in-house or with our clients.
   

  

 We’ll shape the role to fit both your needs and ours. The good thing? You will be surrounded by people who are technically savvy, giving you plenty of opportunities to teach and learn. And if not technically, then perhaps in entrepreneurship. We know - it’s a lot of questions. That’s why we have interviews, right?
   

  

**Who are you:**
* At least 5 years experience in Software engineering.
* At least 2 years of hands-on experience designing, training, and deploying AI/ML models in production using Python and modern ML frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX, or similar)
* Deep understanding of AI techniques such as deep learning, NLP, computer vision, and/or generative AI (LLMs, transformers, diffusion models)
* Hands-on experience of AI solutions in cloud environments (AWS, GCP, Azure)
* Strong experience with MLOps practices, including CI/CD for ML, model versioning, experiment tracking, monitoring, and retraining (e.g., MLflow, SageMaker, Vertex AI, Kubeflow)
* Proven ability to design robust and scalable inference architectures (batch, real-time, low-latency APIs)
* Experience working with large-scale data preparation and feature engineering pipelines for ML systems
* Practical experience adapting and productionizing foundation models and LLMs (fine-tuning, prompt engineering, RAG architectures)
* Strong understanding of model performance, bias, fairness, explainability, and responsible AI principles
* Ability to translate complex business problems into end-to-end AI solutions, from proof of concept to production
* Solid understanding of security, privacy, and regulatory requirements related to AI (e.g., GDPR, upcoming AI regulations)
* Experience with containerized environments and IaC (Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform)
* Great communication and collaboration skills
* Fluent in English and Swedish


**SwedQ culture**
 SwedQ began with siblings who brought in people they knew. Those people recommended friends, and from there, the company grew further through open head-hunting. Over time, we’ve built a diverse team with different backgrounds, experiences, and insights.
   

  

 We made sure to amplify this diversity by embracing independence and accountability while driving value-creating work. At the same time, we make sure to have fun—with epic football tournaments, unforgettable trips, and great dinners.
   

  

**Perks & Benefits**
* Competitive salary—you decide your preferred salary model
* Budget to spend on health and gym
* Generous developer budget
* Monthly payments into your additional pension fund
* Private health insurance
* Private healthcare
* Office in the city – a stone’s throw from public transport and lunch restaurants
* Breakfast in the SwedQ office EVERYDAY
* Support for open-source projects and community engagement
* Kick-ass colleagues and mentors at every corner
* Company car (or car allowance)
* Benefits to make life easier—home cleaning, childcare, and more

title: Engineering Manager - Solutions Engineering
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

 We want to transform the world of software operations by enabling true model-driven operations via next-generation infrastructure-as-code. This will allow companies to run very efficient bare-metal operations for high-performance computing, private cloud, data lakes, AI/ML, and analytics. We need to invent some new technology, and we need to build some new products; we are therefore looking for someone who can lead and inspire a regional software engineering team to fulfill this initiative.
   

  

 The Solutions Engineering team works in close collaboration with our managed infrastructure operations team, which runs many private OpenStack clouds and Kubernetes clusters for customers around the world. This enables us to improve our infra-as-code products based on our own real experience, mirroring that of our users and customers. We work in Python, creating open-source automation capabilities that simplify operations for anybody, anywhere, who is building on Ubuntu.
   

  

 Most of the team's work involves pure Python software development focused on enabling true DevOps workflows. We strive for high quality in both design, documentation, tests, and performance as we enhance operations code packages and Ubuntu itself in order to ensure our platform is the easiest, most robust, and best performing for driving your infrastructure.
   

  

 As an Engineering Manager, your primary responsibility is to the people you lead and support: ensuring that they are growing as engineers, doing valuable work, and finding satisfaction in their career at Canonical. We need someone who can display technical leadership by leveraging a solid background in software development so that they're able to challenge and grow their team members. You will have the opportunity to influence the culture, facilitate technical delivery, and work with your team on direction and execution.
   

  

 What you will do
   

  

* Lead and develop a team of Python engineers working remotely in global locations
* Hiring, coaching, mentoring, feedback, and hands-on career development
* Demonstrate sound engineering principles by directly contributing code yourself
* Plan and manage progress on agreed goals and projects
* Set and manage expectations with other engineering and operations teams
* Coordinate with management and internal and external stakeholders or customers
* Advocate for modern, agile software development practices
* Help develop and evangelize great engineering and organizational practices
* Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values
* Be an active part of the leadership team and collaborate with other leaders in the organisation
* Travel globally up to 10% of time for internal and external events


 Who you are
   

  

* You love developing and growing people and have a track record of doing it
* You are knowledgeable and passionate about agile software development
* You love leading, coaching, and mentoring software developers - especially Python ones
* You are knowledgeable in cloud computing concepts & technologies
* You are comfortable administrating Linux servers, including their storage and networking
* You have hands-on experience with software automation
* You are organized and want your team to deliver high-quality software in a timely manner
* You are a lifelong learner


 Bonus points for
   

  

* You have graduated with a university degree in Computer Science or related software engineering field
* Having a thorough understanding of modern infrastructure, including OpenStack or Kubernetes
* Having experience in operations as well as software development
* Being familiar with the challenges of large-scale, multi-cloud operations
* Go expertise


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Senior Product Manager, ZellisONE
description:
We are hiring for
 **Zellis** 
 , a fast-moving technology company. Zellis and Benifex are sister companies, both operating under in the Zellis group.
 



  





 ZellisONE combines HR, Workforce Management, Pay, Talent and Benefits in one AI-enabled, configurable platform. Trusted to pay more than two million employees every month, we help organisations run payroll at scale, while unifying the full people experience.
 



 Our vision is to be the clear leader in pay, reward, analytics, and people experiences. We're passionate about creating an environment where people want to join, belong to, and be part of a progressive organisation.
 



  





**Why should you apply? 🌟** 



* Your chance to lead the end‑to‑end expansion of ZellisONE into the Swedish payroll & HR technology market
* Shape localisation strategy, product design, and go‑to‑market execution for an entirely new geography
* Become the organisation’s voice of the Swedish customer, influencing senior stakeholders and product strategy
* Work for a profitable, fast‑growing market leader in the HR Technology arena



  





**Please note we are unable to offer visa sponsorship and require to people to be based in Sweden for this position** 




  





**Role Overview 🚀** 




 As our
 **Senior Product Manager** 
 for Sweden, you will lead the localisation, specification, and commercial success of ZellisONE in the Swedish market. You’ll transform customer, market, and regulatory insight into product strategy, define Sweden‑specific capabilities, collaborate closely with engineering and design and be a key voice in the go‑to‑market process.
 



 This is a unique opportunity to build something from the ground up, ensuring our product is market‑fit, compliant, and loved by Swedish users.
 



  





**Responsibilities 🤘** 



* Serve as the internal Swedish market expert, bringing deep insight into HR, payroll, tax, and employment legislation
* Conduct research, interviews and discovery to shape requirements for Swedish‑specific product functionality
* Own the end‑to‑end specification of localised features, writing epics, features and user stories
* Partner with engineering and design to deliver high‑quality, compliant, fit‑for‑purpose solutions
* Drive prioritisation using customer value, commercial impact, and technical constraints
* Shape Sweden’s go‑to‑market strategy, including positioning, messaging and launch readiness
* Support Sales with demos, customer conversations, and RFP responses
* Track post‑launch adoption and commercial performance, refining the product direction
* Build strong stakeholder relationships across Product, Engineering, Compliance, Sales, Marketing and Leadership



  





**What are we looking for? 🔎** 



* Extensive experience in HR Technology, working to improve SaaS products for customers across the Nordic region
* A strong understanding of the Swedish HR, payroll, and employment landscape
* Experience launching products into new European markets
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to simplify complexity
* A proactive problem‑solver who thrives in ambiguity and leads cross‑functional teams effectively
* Fluency in English & Swedish



  





**Our interview process** 




 We understand the need to have a fast and efficient process, the below will all be completed in the shortest time possible.
 



 📞 Initial call with the Talent team
 



 ⏳ Interviews with the hiring manager and key stakeholders
 



 🤩 Final interview with the Zellis CEO
 



  





**We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.** 




  





**We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels welcome and respected. We believe that diversity and inclusion are essential to our success, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.**

title: Forward Deployed Engineer
description:
**TL;DR** 
 – We’re looking for an exceptional Forward Deployed Engineer to help build the future of AI-powered software creation. You will be the founding member of our FDE function, working directly with our most ambitious customers to translate impossible ideas into real products. This is a unique opportunity to design a new discipline from scratch and solve problems with AI that no one has solved before.
   

  

 Why Lovable?
   

  

 Lovable lets anyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products — fast. We are at the forefront of a fundamental shift in how software is created: from code-first to intelligence-first.
   

  

 Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate workflows, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We operate with high ownership, high velocity, and low-ego collaboration. We care deeply, move fast, and are here to build something that outlives us.
   

  

 What makes this role special?
   

  

 This isn’t a traditional software engineering role.
   

  

 You will:
   

  

* Be the first Forward Deployed Engineer at Lovable
* Create a new function at the intersection of engineering, product, customer success, and research
* Partner with customers building never-seen-before AI systems
* Build product features based on real-world behaviors and emerging patterns
* Influence our core product direction and technical roadmap


 If you want to invent new categories, not just improve existing ones - this is that role.
   

  

 What we’re looking for
   

  

* 5+ years of experience building and shipping full-stack products
* Proficiency in modern frontend (React/TypeScript) and robust backend development
* Strong architectural thinking and familiarity with distributed systems
* Ability to rapidly prototype, experiment, and learn from real usage
* Exceptional product intuition and ability to work directly with users
* Comfort operating in high-ambiguity, high-agency environments


 Bonus if you’ve:
   

  

* Worked on agentic AI systems or built with LLMs before
* Led zero-to-one product development
* Worked in a founding or early startup environment


 What you’ll do
   

  

 In one sentence: Deploy intelligence into the real world.
   

  

* Work directly with customers to understand their workflows, needs, and problems
* Design and implement solutions for our customers that integrate with Lovable
* Translate insights from real usage into foundational platform improvements
* Own projects end-to-end — from idea → architecture → shipping → iteration
* Shape how Forward Deployed Engineering works at Lovable (rituals, playbooks, org design)
* Contribute to core product strategy, technical decisions, and cultural foundations


 Our Tech Stack
   

  

 We choose tools that empower both humans and AI:
   

  

* Frontend: React, Typescript
* Backend: Golang & Rust
* Cloud: Cloudflare, GCP, AWS, multiple LLM providers
* Tooling: Github Actions, OTEL, Grafana, Terraform, and more
* Always evolving with what works best.


 How we hire
   

  

* Fill out a short form and hop on a brief intro call with our recruiting team.
* Complete a quick live coding exercise.
* Show us how you approach problems during several technical interviews.
* Show us something you’ve built that makes you proud.


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English - it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal.

title: Finance & BizOps - EPD
description:
**TL;DR** 
 You will serve as the strategic finance partner for our Engineering, Product & Design teams, architecting our commercial relationships with major AI model providers and optimizing cloud economics to drive efficient technical scaling.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with any language. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software development, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to transform the way the digital world operates. Over 2 million people in more than 200 countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate tasks, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity, and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* Hyperscaler Strategist & Deal Architect: You understand the nuances of usage-based pricing and token economics. You are a seasoned negotiator who can align internal teams and go toe-to-toe with technical vendors to structure deals that balance unit economics, committed spend, and flexibility.
* Technical & Analytical Authority: You have the "Excel expert" modeling chops, data skills (SQL, Hex, BI tools), and technical literacy to gain immediate credibility with Engineering leaders. You can easily translate technical concepts/decisions into financial impact.
* Service-First Partner: You bring a proactive, "can-do" attitude to every interaction and are comfortable owning the operationally tedious work required to ensure clean handoffs between technical teams, finance, and procurement.
* Finance & BizOps Veteran: You bring 8+ years of relevant experience, including 4+ years in strategic finance and BizOps supporting R&D/EPD at a SaaS company. Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (Finance, Business, Engineering, Mathematics, or similar).


**What You’ll Do**
* Drive Hyperscaler 360 Strategy: You will orchestrate the strategy for Lovable’s relationships with model providers, aligning cross-functional teams to ensure we are building strategic alliances, not just buying tokens.
* Architect High-Value Partnerships: You will lead commercial negotiations with LLM providers and technical partners, securing competitive pricing, favorable terms, and capacity commitments that protect our margins as we scale.
* Run Financial Operations for EPD: You will implement rigorous FinOps practices, linking model performance and usage data to financial outcomes to ensure every dollar spent on compute generates tangible value.
* Drive EPD Planning & Investment: You will own headcount planning, budgeting, and investment tradeoffs for the EPD org to enable fast execution without waste.
* Build an AI-Native Function: You will reject the status quo of manual spreadsheet work by integrating AI agents and automation into the finance workflow, building a modern infrastructure that moves at the speed of Lovable’s AI platform.

title: Produktägare Inköp
description:
Symbrio har över 20 års erfarenhet av agil produktutveckling, där rollen som produktägare är en central nyckelroll. Symbrios produktledning söker nu en produktägare för vårt produktområde Inköp.
 



  





 Rollen är mångsidig och kräver både bredd och djup. Som förvaltare av produktvisionen arbetar du nära både externa och interna intressenter för att säkerställa att vi bygger ”rätt sak” – från övergripande produktvision till att bryta ner krav i konkreta scenarier som utvecklare och kvalitetsansvariga kan implementera och underhålla.
 



  
 



**Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden** 




**Produktstrategi:** 
 Att bygga en produktstrategi och roadmap tillsammans med övriga produktledning som säkerställer affärsnytta och ROI.
 



**Kravhantering:** 
 Definiera användarscenarier, primärt för systemstöd i inköpsprocesser, tillsammans med både externa och interna kravställare samt annan processtödjande affärslogik.
 



**Kravanalys:** 
 Bryta ner krav till detaljerade funktionella specifikationer som fungerar som funktionsfacit för både utvecklare och kvalitetsansvariga.
 



**Aktivt utvecklingssamarbete:** 
 Genom aktivt deltagande i par- eller grupprogrammering för kravställning och validering i realtid så minimeras överlämningar och maximerar vår agila arbetsprocess.
 



  





**Övriga ansvarsområden** 




 Du fungerar som en strategisk brygga mellan utvecklingsavdelningen (R&D) och resten av organisationen, där du har ett nära och återkommande samarbete med avdelningarna för Professional Services, Maintenance och Sales. Utöver att vara funktionsfacit för utvecklingsteamet, bidrar du som bollplank med djup funktionell kunskap mot support, projektledare och kundansvariga.
 



  





**Kund- och domänexpertis** 




 På Symbrio fungerar produktägaren som den centrala länken som omsätter kundernas behov till värdeskapande funktionalitet. Genom din djupa expertis inom installationsbranschens inköpsprocesser och ED-standarder intar du en rådgivande roll som inger förtroende och skapar tydlighet. Du behärskar kundens affärskritiska terminologi och branschspecifika språk obehindrat, vilket möjliggör en sömlös dialog mellan affärsnytta och teknisk leverans. Ditt uppdrag sträcker sig bortom att enbart möta dagens behov; du identifierar proaktivt framtida krav och presenterar innovativa lösningar.
 



  





**Kompetens och erfarenhet** 




 Vi värdesätter följande färdigheter och erfarenheter i vår urvalsprocess:
 


* Erfarenhet av Source-to-Pay (S2P) och Purchase-to-Pay (P2P)
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med SaaS-produkter och meddelandebaserade integrationsflöden inom B2B
* Djupt rotad i agila arbetsflöden och lean-principer för att säkerställa effektiv leverans
* ”Trilingual” i svenska, engelska och ”tech” med förmåga att sömlöst växla från ROI-förhandlingar med inköpschefer till att skriva detaljerade ”Given-When-Then”-stories för utvecklare, med full professionell färdighet i båda språken
* Tekniskt grundad i webbarkitektur och relationella databaser, med god vana av Microsofts ekosystem (t.ex. .NET, Azure och SQL Server).



  





 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är en person med hög personlig stabilitet som bibehåller din strategiska skärpa även i komplexa och föränderliga situationer. Du navigerar skickligt mellan motstridiga intressentkrav och besitter den integritet och uthållighet som krävs för att prioritera objektivt med ett orubbligt fokus på produktens övergripande mål och framgång.

title: Fullstack Product Engineer
description:

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value high ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek people who care deeply, challenge us, and are driven to build something of lasting impact.

title: Presales Solution Consultant, CPQ
description:
**Company Description**
 It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a member of our Solution Consulting team, you will play a pivotal role in accelerating our EMEA revenue growth by supporting CRM, CPQ, and digital commerce solution sales across a range of industries. You will act as a hands-on technical consultant and strategic advisor, collaborating closely with Sales, Product Management, and cross-functional stakeholders to craft customer-centric solutions. This role combines deep technical acumen with strong business insight to drive high-impact engagements throughout the pre-sales cycle.
   

  

**What You Get To Do In This Role**
 The Advisory Solution Consultant is a senior-level technical expert responsible for developing and positioning tailored solutions during the sales process. You’ll guide customers through discovery, design, and demonstration, aligning solutions with their business objectives while helping drive sales performance.
   

  

* Support sales efforts as a technical and domain expert across CRM, CPQ, and automation platforms
* Lead engaging technical discovery sessions and workshops to uncover customer challenges and use cases
* Design and deliver tailored product demonstrations that effectively highlight business value
* Build trusted relationships with both technical and executive stakeholders, including C-level decision-makers
* Provide actionable insights and feedback to Product and Engineering teams to improve offerings
* Share best practices, reusable assets, and industry knowledge with the broader Solution Consulting team
* Stay up to date on market trends, competitors, and emerging technologies
* Represent the company at key marketing and customer events, including workshops, briefings, and conferences


**Qualifications**
 To be successful in this role, you have:
   

  

* 7+ years of experience in pre-sales solution consulting, sales engineering, or a similar role
* Deep expertise in CRM and CPQ technologies, ideally across platforms like Salesforce, ServiceNow, SAP, Oracle, Adobe, or Shopify
* Strong technical understanding of APIs, middleware, cloud-native architecture, and web technologies (JavaScript, JSON)
* Proven experience conducting technical discovery sessions and designing customer-focused solutions
* Excellent communication and presentation skills across technical and business audiences
* Strong collaboration skills, with experience working cross-functionally with Sales, Product, Engineering, and Marketing teams
* Ability to think strategically and operate independently in a fast-paced, remote-first environment
* Confidence and experience in engaging executive-level stakeholders and influencing strategic decisions
* ServiceNow or other relevant cloud platform certifications are a plus
* Experience within industry verticals such as manufacturing, telecommunications, or technology
* Travel Requirements: Up to 25% travel for client meetings, workshops, and events
* Language Requirements: English ans Swedish fluency required


 Additional Information
   

  

**Work Personas**
 We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here. To determine eligibility for a work persona, ServiceNow may confirm the distance between your primary residence and the closest ServiceNow office using a third-party service.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.
   

  

**Accommodations**
 We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.
   

  

**Export Control Regulations**
 For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.
   

  

 From Fortune. ©2025 Fortune Media IP Limited. All rights reserved. Used under license.

description:
